other zone of quiet declared by any ordinance shall be designated by the Engineering Department by placing at a conspicuous place in the street a sign or
marking bearing the words "quiet zone". (Ord. 11-15, 9-20-2011)
9-2-9: PUBLIC CARRIER STANDS:
The Engineering Department is hereby authorized and required to establish bus stops and taxicab stands and standards for other passenger common
carrier motor vehicles on such public streets in such places and in such number as shall be determined to be of the greatest benefit and convenience to
the public, and every bus stop, taxicab stand or other stand shall be designated by appropriate signs. (Ord. 11-15, 9-20-2011)
9-2-10: THROUGH HIGHWAYS, STOP OR REDUCED SPEED INTERSECTIONS:
Whenever any provision of this Code designates and describes a through street, it shall be the duty of the Engineering Department to place and maintain a
stop sign on each and every street intersection or through street or that portion thereof described and designated as such by any provision of this Code.
(Ord. 11-15, 9-20-2011)
9-2-11: HAZARDOUS INTERSECTIONS:
The Engineering Department is hereby authorized to determine and designate intersections where particular hazard exists upon other than through streets
and to determine whether vehicles shall stop at one (1) or more entrances to any such stop intersection, and shall erect a stop sign at every such place
where a stop is required. (Ord. 11-15, 9-20-2011; amd. 2017 Code)
9-2-12: WEIGHT LIMIT, EXCEPTIONS; EMBARGO ESTABLISHED:
It shall be unlawful for any person to operate a vehicle having a gross weight in excess of an established weight as set by the City Engineer for a public
way. The exception is City vehicles providing essential services such as snow removal and garbage collection.
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 189/358
A. Streets to which weight limitations have been established at twenty thousand (20,000) pounds are as follows:
Birch Drive from North Illinois Avenue to Fourth Street Southeast.
Cerro Gordo Way from Garfield Avenue to Fourth Street Southwest.
North Adams Avenue from Twelfth Street Northwest to Sixteenth Street Northwest.
North Jefferson Avenue from Twelfth Street Northwest to Sixteenth Street Northwest.
North Madison Avenue from Twelfth Street Northwest to Sixteenth Street Northwest.
North President Avenue from Twelfth Street Northwest to Seventeenth Street Northwest.
North Washington Avenue from Twelfth Street Northwest to Seventeenth Street Northwest.
South Hampshire Avenue from Twelfth Street Southeast to Nineteenth Street Southeast.
South Massachusetts Avenue from Twelfth Street Southeast to Nineteenth Street Southeast.
First Street Northwest from west line of North Pierce Avenue to east line of East Parkridge Drive and Winnebago Way from east line of East Parkridge
Drive to north line of Fourth Street Southwest (Highway 18 west).
Sixth Street Southeast from South Massachusetts Avenue to South Carolina Avenue.
Eleventh Street Southwest from Federal Avenue to Washington Avenue.
Fourteenth Street Northwest from North Federal Avenue to North Quincy Avenue.
Fifteenth Street Northwest from Federal Avenue to Quincy Avenue.
Sixteenth Street Northwest from North Federal Avenue to North Quincy Avenue. (Ord. 11-15, 9-20-2011)
B. Bridges to which weight limitations have been established are as follows:
1. Bridge on Willowbrook Drive between Brook Terrace and Meadow Lane, weight limitation established at twelve thousand (12,000) pounds.
2. Bridge on Twelfth Street Northwest between the north and south North Taft Avenue intersections, weight limitation established at twenty (20) tons for
straight trucks, twenty four (24) tons for truck plus semitrailer, and twenty four (24) tons for truck plus double trailer combinations; maximum load limit
of twenty four (24) tons for all vehicles. (Ord. 11-15, 9-20-2011; amd. 2017 Code)
C. The Engineering Department is hereby ordered to post appropriate signs on said designated public ways giving notice of said weight limit.
D. Weight restrictions established on streets, avenues or alleys should not be applicable to the driving or operation of any such truck or commercial vehicle
upon the streets, avenues or alleys designated if such driving or operation is necessary in the conduct of a business in order to reach destinations
abutting such designated street or if the destination cannot be reached except by driving on such designated street nor shall this restriction be
applicable to emergency vehicles responding to an emergency call. (Ord. 11-15, 9-20-2011)
9-2-13: PENALTY:
Any person violating any of the terms or provisions of this chapter shall, upon conviction, be guilty of a misdemeanor. (Ord. 11-15, 9-20-2011)

Chapter 5
ALL-TERRAIN VEHICLES AND UTILITY TERRAIN VEHICLES
9-5-1: OPERATION OF ALL-TERRAIN VEHICLES AND UTILITY TERRAIN VEHICLES:
A registered all-terrain or utility terrain vehicle may be operated on City streets that are subject to speed limits of thirty five (35) miles per hour or less
within the City limits of Mason City under the following conditions:
A. The operation of the vehicle is for snow removal purposes on private driveways and sidewalks.
B. The operation of the vehicle on City streets is strictly for transportation to and from the site of the snow removal and the vehicle shall be equipped with a
functioning blade or snowblower at all times during operation.
C. The all-terrain vehicle/utility terrain vehicle and the driver of said vehicle shall meet all State requirements for the legal operation of the vehicle. (Ord.
13-33, 12-17-2013)
9-5-2: DEFINITIONS:
ALL-TERRAIN VEHICLE OR ATV: A motorized flotation tire vehicle with not less than three (3) low pressure tires, but not more than six (6) low pressure
tires, that is limited in engine displacement to less than nine hundred (900) cubic centimeters and in total dry weight to less than one thousand (1,000)
pounds and that has a seat or saddle designed to be straddled by the operator and handlebars for steering control.
FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY/LIABILITY COVERAGE: Any of the following:
A. An owner's policy of liability insurance which is issued by an insurance carrier authorized to do business in Iowa to or for the benefit of the person
named in the policy as insured, and insuring the person named as insured and any person using an insured motor vehicle with the express or implied
permission of the named insured against loss from liability imposed by law for damages arising out of the ownership, maintenance, or use of an
insured motor vehicle within the United States of America or Canada, but subject to minimum limits, exclusive of interest and costs, in the amounts
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 196/358
specified in section 321A.21 or specified in another provision of the Code, whichever is greater.
B. A bond filed with the department pursuant to section 321A.24.
C. A valid statement issued by the Treasurer of State pursuant to section 321A.25 attesting to the filing of a certificate of deposit with the Treasurer of
State.
D. A valid certificate of self-insurance issued by the department pursuant to section 321A.34.
UTILITY TERRAIN VEHICLE OR UTV OR OFF ROAD UTILITY VEHICLE OR ORV: A motorized flotation tire vehicle with not less than four (4) low
pressure tires, but not more than eight (8) low pressure tires, that is limited in engine displacement to less than one thousand five hundred (1,500) cubic
centimeters and in total dry weight not more than two thousand (2,000) pounds and that has a seat that is bucket or bench design, not intended to be
straddled by the operator and steering wheel or control levers for control. Off road utility vehicle does not include dune buggies, golf carts, go-carts or
minitrucks. (Ord. 13-33, 12-17-2013)
9-5-3: PROOF OF REGISTRATION, CURRENT FINANCIAL RESPONSIBILITY AND AGE FOR OPERATION OF ALL-TERRAIN
VEHICLES:
No person shall operate an ATV on any public street or alley unless the operator possesses the following documents. The operator must carry these
documents when operating the all-terrain vehicle:
A. Evidence that the ATV is registered according to Iowa law and that such registration is current. The owner/operator shall maintain such registration.
B. Evidence that the operator is at least eighteen (18) years of age, and possesses a valid Iowa driver's license.
C. Proof of current financial responsibility/liability in accordance with section 321.20B of the Code of Iowa. The owner/operator shall maintain such
financial responsibility.
D. UTVs are not currently required to be registered with the Iowa DNR but when registration of UTVs is required, owners shall maintain proof of
registration. (Ord. 13-33, 12-17-2013)
9-5-4: STREETS DESIGNATED FOR OPERATION:
All-terrain vehicles and utility terrain vehicles may be operated upon the roadway portion of all streets within the City limits except as hereinafter prohibited
by ordinance. (Ord. 13-33, 12-17-2013)
9-5-5: PROHIBITED OPERATION:
It shall be unlawful for any person to operate an all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle upon a public street as permitted by this chapter except in strict
accordance with the following provisions:
A. No person shall operate an all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle upon any portion of a street except the roadway portion thereof.
B. Any person operating an all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle upon any street shall drive upon the most right hand lane of the roadway available for
traffic or as close as practicable to the right hand curb or edge of the roadway, except when overtaking another vehicle stopped in that lane or
proceeding in the same direction.
C. No person shall operate an all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle upon a street in excess of a maximum speed of thirty five (35) miles per hour, or
than is reasonable or proper under all existing circumstances.
D. An all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle may make a direct crossing over a street, including a street which constitutes an extension of a State or
Federal primary highway within the City limits, but no person shall make a direct crossing of any such street with the all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain
vehicle unless:
1. The crossing is made at an angle of approximately ninety degrees (90°) to the direction of the street and at a place where no obstruction prevents a
quick and safe crossing;
2. The all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle complies with all traffic regulations;
3. The driver yields the right-of-way to all oncoming traffic which constitutes an immediate hazard; and
4. When crossing a divided street, the crossing shall be made only at an intersection of such street with another street.
E. No person shall operate an all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle except in compliance with all other ordinances of the City, which pertain to the use,
operation and parking of motor vehicles, unless otherwise expressly provided by this chapter or except those which, by their nature, have no
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 197/358
application to the operation of all-terrain vehicles or utility terrain vehicles. All ordinances of the City which pertain to the use, operation and parking of
motor vehicles are incorporated herein by reference as though the same were fully set forth herein.
F. No person shall operate an all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle in a careless, reckless or negligent manner so as to endanger the person or
property of another or to cause injury or damage thereto.
G. No person shall operate an all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle while under the influence of intoxicating liquor, narcotics, habit forming drugs or
psychoactive drugs whether prescribed or not prescribed.
H. No person shall operate an all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle at any time on a street without the required headlight and taillight being lighted
during the operation of such all-terrain vehicles or utility terrain vehicles. (Ord. 13-33, 12-17-2013)
9-5-6: PROHIBITED AREAS OF OPERATION:
It shall be unlawful for any person to operate an all-terrain vehicle or utility terrain vehicle within the City:
A. Upon any portion of a street other than the roadway portion thereof;
B. Upon any portion of a street which constitutes an extension of a State or Federal primary highway within the City limits, except as otherwise herein
provided with respect to the permitted crossing of such streets;
C. Upon public property other than the roadway portion of permitted streets except as otherwise specifically permitted by ordinance of the City or by rule or
regulation of the Park Board of the City;
D. Upon any private property without the specific permission of the owner of such property or the person in control of such property or upon public property
owned by the State or any other governmental subdivision other than the City without the specific permission of the State or any such governmental
subdivision. (Ord. 13-33, 12-17-2013)
Chapter 6
PARKING ENFORCEMENT BUREAU
9-6-1: BUREAU CREATED:
The Police Chief shall establish a Parking Enforcement Bureau to assist him with clerical work on parking violations and traffic cases. The Chief of Police
shall be in charge of the bureau which shall be open at such hours as he may designate. (Ord. 12-15, 12-18-2012)
9-6-2: DUTIES OF BUREAU:
The following duties are hereby imposed upon the Parking Enforcement Bureau:
A. It shall collect parking fees, keep sufficient records of the same, account for the same and transmit the same to the City Clerk, all as prescribed by
section 8-2-5 of this Code.
B. It shall collect fines for overtime parking violations and parking violations other than overtime parking violations, keep sufficient records of the same,
account for the same and transmit the same to the City Clerk, all as prescribed by section 8-2-5 of this Code.
C. It shall keep records of all traffic violations of which each person has been guilty during the preceding twelve (12) months whether such guilt was
established in court or indicated by the record of the Parking Enforcement Bureau.
D. If a notice of fine for a parking violation, in a form prescribed by section 9-10-16 of this title, has been given by placing the original or copy thereof in
plain sight on the windshield of the vehicle, and the fine is not paid as prescribed in such notice and as established by this Code, the bureau shall
cause such violation to be filed against the registered owner thereof who shall be prima facie responsible for said violation. It shall be a misdemeanor
for any person to permit or allow a motor vehicle to be parked in violation of the provisions of this Code. (Ord. 12-15, 12-18-2012)
9-6-3: BUREAU RECORDS:
The Parking Enforcement Bureau shall keep records of all notices of fines issued within the City and all fees and fines collected by the Parking
Enforcement Bureau under the provisions of this chapter. Such records shall be maintained so as to show all types of violations, final disposition, and the
totals of each. (Ord. 12-15, 12-18-2012)
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 198/358
Chapter 7
OFF STREET PARKING
9-7-1: PARKING SPACES:
The Mason City Engineering Department is hereby authorized and directed to mark off individual parking spaces on all parking lots, said parking spaces to
be designated by lines painted or durably marked on the surface or curbing of the parking lot. At each space so marked off, it shall be unlawful to park any
vehicle in such a way that said vehicle shall not be entirely within the limits of the space so designated. (Ord. 12-16, 12-18-2012)
9-7-2: PARKING TIME LIMITS:
Parking or standing of a vehicle in a designated public or leased parking space shall be lawful for a period of time and for such fee as may be fixed by the
City Council. Where no parking time limit is prescribed, it shall be unlawful for any person to leave, abandon or park any vehicle on any public parking lot
for a period of time exceeding twenty four (24) hours. It shall also be unlawful to park any vehicle in a leased parking space in a public parking lot if the
vehicle does not display a current leased parking permit issued by the City for that vehicle on their front dash. Any vehicle parked in violation of this section
or parked in violation of any other ordinance, regulation or lawful police order of the City is hereby found and declared to constitute an obstruction to the
public parking lot areas, and a public nuisance and may be issued a parking violation notice of fine and/or removed in accordance with the provisions of
chapter 10 of this title, as they apply to the removal of vehicles from public streets, avenues or alleys. (Ord. 12-16, 12-18-2012)
9-7-3: TRUCK PARKING:
No vehicle used primarily for the transportation of property, and no vehicle used primarily for commercial transportation of persons, shall park in or upon
any parking lot unless said vehicle is of such length and width as to park within the designated lines of the parking space. (Ord. 12-16, 12-18-2012)
9-7-4: ONE-WAY TRAFFIC:
The entrances, drives and exits to any of the off street parking lots shall be designated as one-way traffic lanes as the Engineering Department shall
designate. The Operations and Maintenance Department is hereby authorized and directed by the Engineering Department to post signs on said
entrances, drives and exits of parking lots designated one-way traffic as deemed necessary. When one-way traffic signs are in place on any public parking
lot, it shall be unlawful for any person to drive a vehicle thereon except in the direction indicated by said posted signs. (Ord. 12-16, 12-18-2012)
9-7-5: PENALTY:
Any person violating any of the terms or provisions of this chapter shall, upon conviction, be guilty of a simple misdemeanor. (Ord. 12-16, 12-18-2012)
Chapter 8
ONE-WAY STREETS AND ALLEYS
9-8-1: STREETS OR ALLEYS DESIGNATED:
The following streets, avenues, alleys, or parts thereof, are hereby made one-way streets, avenues and alleys, or parts thereof, and vehicles shall be
driven only in the direction hereinbelow indicated for such streets, avenues, alleys, or parts thereof: (Ord. 15-08, 8-4-2015)

South Massachusetts Avenue from Sixth Street Southeast to Fifth Street Southeast.

B. Southbound:
Washington Avenue from Fifth Street Northwest to Fourth Street Southwest.
C. Westbound:
Fifth Street south from South Massachusetts Avenue to South Madison Avenue.
Eleventh Street Northeast "A" Alley from Pennsylvania Avenue to Twelfth Street Northeast.

9-8-2: PENALTY:
Any person violating any of the terms or provisions of this chapter shall, upon conviction, be guilty of a misdemeanor. (1985 Code)
Chapter 9
BICYCLES
9-9-1: EFFECT OF REGULATIONS:
It shall be unlawful for any person to do any act forbidden or fail to perform any act required in this chapter. These regulations applicable to bicycles shall
apply whenever a bicycle is operated upon any street or upon any public path set aside for the use of bicycles, subject to those exceptions stated herein.
(Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-2: BICYCLE LICENSE PROCEDURES:
Mason City residents may license their bicycles at the Police Department during normal business hours.
A. Application: Application for a bicycle license and license tag may be made upon a form provided by the Police Department and shall be made in person
at the Police Department.
B. Inspection: Police Department staff reserve the right to examine the bicycle in order to verify ownership and accuracy of information before issuing a
bicycle license.
C. Issuance Of License: Upon receiving proper application, Police Department staff are authorized to issue a bicycle license. Staff shall not issue a license
for any bicycle when he or she knows or has reasonable grounds to believe that the applicant is not the owner of or entitled to the possession of such
bicycle. The Police Department shall keep a record of the numbers of each license, the date issued, the name and address of the person to whom
issued and a brief description of the bicycle licensed. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-3: REMOVAL OF TAG/ALTERATION OF SERIAL NUMBER:
No person shall remove a license tag from a bicycle during the period for which issued unless the bicycle is permanently dismantled or the bicycle is no
longer operated upon any street in this City. It is unlawful for any person to wilfully or maliciously remove, destroy, mutilate or alter the manufacturer's
serial number of any bicycle. It is unlawful to possess a bicycle in the City whose serial number has been intentionally removed, defaced, or altered to
prevent identification. Bicycles with missing, altered, or obscured serial numbers may be seized by police in an attempt to verify ownership. Police
Department staff have discretion to allow verified legitimate bicycle owners to retain their bicycle if they have reported their bicycles stolen to police
contemporaneous to the recovery of reported but altered bicycle. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-4: TRANSFER OF OWNERSHIP:
Upon the sale or other transfer of a licensed bicycle, the new owner may, upon proper application and verification from the prior owner, have said tag
reassigned to the new applicant/owner. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-5: RENTAL AGENCIES:
A rental agency shall not rent or offer any bicycle for rent unless the bicycle is equipped as required by the provisions of this chapter. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-
2013)
9-9-6: TRAFFIC LAWS APPLY:
Bicycle regulations are subject to all applicable motor vehicle and traffic regulations as established by Iowa Code section 321.234 and any subsequent
revisions thereto. The City has enacted additional specific bicycle regulations by local authority under Iowa Code section 321.236 and any subsequent
revisions thereto. Sections in this chapter without a specific reference to an Iowa Code section are the additional local bicycle regulations in effect. (Ord.
13-19, 6-4-2013)
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 200/358
9-9-7: RIDING ON BICYCLES:
Bicycle riding and seating regulations are established by Iowa Code section 321.234 and any subsequent revisions thereto. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-8: SPEED AND STOPPING REQUIREMENTS:
No person shall operate a bicycle at a speed greater than is reasonable and prudent under the conditions then existing. Speed and stopping regulations
are established by Iowa Code section 321.285 and any subsequent revisions thereto. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-9: PEDESTRIAN RIGHT-OF-WAY REQUIREMENTS:
Stop requirements before crossing a sidewalk, and related right-of-way to pedestrians is established by Iowa Code section 321.353 and all subsequent
revisions thereto. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-10: CLINGING TO VEHICLES:
No person riding upon any bicycle shall attach the same or himself to any other vehicle upon a roadway. It is unlawful for any person riding a bicycle upon
the public roadways of the City to tow or attach any wheeled cart or extension to the bicycle unless the attached object is specifically manufactured for
such use and utilized according to the manufacturer's instructions. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-11: CARRYING ARTICLES:
No person operating a bicycle shall carry any package, bundle or article which prevents the rider from keeping at least one (1) hand upon the handlebar.
(Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-12: PARKING IN BUSINESS DISTRICT:
It shall be unlawful to park any bicycle upon the sidewalks, except in designated areas or stands, or in areas where the parking of automobiles is
prohibited. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-13: RIDING ON SIDEWALKS:
No person shall ride a bicycle upon a sidewalk within a business district. The City Engineering Department is hereby authorized to erect signs on any
sidewalk or roadway prohibiting the riding of bicycles thereon and when such signs are in place, no person shall disobey the same. Whenever any person
is riding a bicycle upon a sidewalk, such person shall yield the right-of-way to any pedestrian and shall give audible signal before overtaking and passing
such pedestrian. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-14: LAMPS AND REFLECTORS:
Lamp and reflector regulations are established by Iowa Code section 321.397 and any subsequent revisions thereto. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
9-9-15: AUDIBLE SIGNAL:
Bicycle siren and whistle regulations are established by Iowa Code section 321.434 and any subsequent revisions thereto. (Ord. 13-19, 6-4-2013)
Chapter 10
STOPPING, STANDING AND PARKING
9-10-1: STOPPING, STANDING OR PARKING PROHIBITED; NO SIGNS REQUIRED:
Except as otherwise provided for in this section, no signs shall be required to make it illegal to stop, stand or park a vehicle contrary to the provisions of
this section. No person shall stop, stand or park a vehicle except when necessary to avoid conflict with traffic or in compliance with instructions of a police
officer or traffic control device in any of the following places:
A. On a sidewalk.
B. In front of a public or private driveway or alley.
C. Within an intersection.
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 201/358
D. On a crosswalk.
E. Within ten feet (10') upon the approach to any flashing beacon, stop sign or traffic control signal located at the side of a street.
F. Within twenty feet (20') of the driveway entrance to any fire station and on the side of a street opposite the entrance to any fire station within seventy five
feet (75') of said driveway entrance when properly signposted.
G. Alongside or opposite any street excavation or obstruction when such stopping, standing or parking would obstruct traffic.
H. On the roadway side of any vehicle stopped or parked at the edge of a curb or street.
I. On the parking area of any street or between the outside edge of any privately owned property and the curb line or traffic portion of a street.
J. On any street in such manner that the vehicle is headed other than in the direction of traffic or with the right hand wheels of said vehicle more than
eighteen inches (18") adjacent from the edge of the right hand curb.
K. Upon any street unless a different parking time limit is required, for a period of time exceeding forty eight (48) hours. Vehicles must be moved at least
twenty feet (20') in distance during each forty eight (48) hour time period in order to avoid penalty under this subsection.
L. On any street in such manner or under such conditions as to leave available less than fifteen feet (15') of the width of the roadway portion of any street
for free movement of vehicular traffic.
M. Upon any street for a commercial vehicle; implements of husbandry; semitractor, semitrailer or combination thereof; two (2) or four (4) wheel trailer;
motorized home; travel trailer; pickup coach; school bus, or school bus converted for recreational or other purposes; for more than four (4) consecutive
hours unless, however, the parking of any of the above is necessary to services being performed or operations being carried on upon adjacent or
nearby premises. Two (2) or four (4) wheel trailers properly attached to a passenger vehicle are subject to the forty eight (48) consecutive hour rule in
subsection K of this section.
The City Engineer or his designee, upon request, may permit parking of any of the above for a period of up to twenty four (24) hours, provided all other
provisions of this Code are complied with.
N. Within five feet (5') of a fire hydrant. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-2: STOPPING, STANDING OR PARKING PROHIBITED AT ALL TIMES; SIGNS REQUIRED:
Where signs are erected prohibiting stopping, standing or parking at any time, no person shall stop, stand or park a vehicle at any time on any such street
or portion of street as indicated by said signs. The Mason City Engineering Department shall direct the Operations and Maintenance Department to install
appropriate signs upon order of the City Council. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-3: STOPPING, STANDING OR PARKING PROHIBITED DURING CERTAIN HOURS, OR BY NONPERMITTED VEHICLES;
SIGNS REQUIRED:
Where signs are erected prohibiting stopping, standing or parking during certain hours or by nonpermitted vehicles, no person shall stop, stand or park a
vehicle, or allow a vehicle to remain parked, upon such street or portion of such street during the hours when such is prohibited, or without continuously
displaying a valid and readily visible City issued parking permit for that section. The Mason City Engineering Department shall direct the Operations and
Maintenance Department to install appropriate signs upon order of the Administrator.
Where temporary signs are erected at least eight (8) hours prior to the start of a project prohibiting stopping, standing or parking during certain periods for
the purpose of snow removal, tree removal, street repairs or excavating, no person shall stop, stand or park a vehicle, or allow a vehicle to remain parked,
upon such street or portion of such street during the hours signs are in place. (Ord. 19-4, 5-21-2019)
9-10-4: PARKING TIME LIMITED ON CERTAIN STREETS; SIGNS REQUIRED:
Where signs are erected limiting the time for which a vehicle may be parked, then no person shall park a vehicle upon such street or portion of street for a
longer duration than specified by such sign. The Mason City Engineering Department shall direct Operations and Maintenance Department to install
appropriate signs upon order of the City Council. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-5: STANDING FOR LOADING PURPOSES:
No person shall stop, stand or park a vehicle for any purpose or period of time other than for the expeditious loading or unloading of passengers or
material in any place marked as a loading zone during hours when the regulations applicable to such loading zone are effective, and then only for a period
not to exceed fifteen (15) minutes. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 202/358
9-10-6: BUS AND TAXICAB STANDS:
The driver of a bus or taxicab shall not stand or park upon any street in any business district at any place other than at a bus or taxicab stand, respectively,
except that this provision shall not prevent the driver of any such vehicle from temporarily stopping in accordance with other stopping and parking
regulations at any place for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading or unloading passengers. No person shall stop, stand or park a vehicle,
other than a bus in a bus stop or a taxicab in a taxicab stand, when any stop or stand has been officially designated and appropriately signed, except that
a driver of a passenger vehicle may temporarily stop therein for the purpose of and while actually engaged in loading or unloading passengers when such
stopping does not interfere with any bus or taxicab waiting to enter or about to enter such zone. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-7: UNLAWFUL PARKING:
No person shall stand or park a vehicle upon any roadway for the principal purpose of:
A. Displaying it for sale;
B. Washing, greasing or repairing such vehicle except repairs necessitated by an emergency. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-8: INDIVIDUAL PARKING SPACES:
The Mason City Engineering Department shall designate the individual parking spaces upon each street or public parking lot by lines or other appropriate
markings painted upon the lot, curb or street. It shall be unlawful to park any vehicle across any such line or marking or to park any vehicle in such position
that it shall not be entirely within the space designated by such lines or markings. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-9: VEHICLES TO BE REMOVED OR DISABLED:
Any vehicle parked upon any public street, avenue, alley or Municipal parking lot in violation of any provision of this chapter may be removed by the Chief
of Police or other designated official to any off street parking area or to a public or private garage and stored in such off street parking area or public or
private garage or lot until claimed by the owner thereof as hereinafter provided. In the case of vehicles parked in violation of the habitual violator provisions
of this chapter, any police officer or parking enforcement officer of the Police Department may, in lieu of removal, place a locking wheel chock or other
similar device on any wheel or tire of the vehicle to prevent its removal until the owner or operator has appeared before the Parking Enforcement Bureau
as required by section 9-10-22 of this chapter. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-10: NOTICE OF REMOVAL OF VEHICLE:
In the event of removal of a vehicle from any public street, avenue or alley by the Police Department, the officer involved shall take reasonable efforts to
notify the registered owner of said vehicle as soon as possible of the following facts:
A. The fact of removal of said vehicle, together with reasons therefor and the place to which removed;
B. A general description of the vehicle, including license number;
C. The charges for removal and the daily cost of storage of said vehicle.
Notification to the registered owner by phone or in person is sufficient. If unable to contact the registered owner, or, if the vehicle is not reclaimed by the
registered owner within fifteen (15) days of the initial notification, written notification shall be sent by mail. The mailed notice to the owner shall be
addressed to the registered owner as shown by the registration certificate on said vehicle and shall be deposited with postage prepaid, by certified mail
with return receipt requested, in the United States Post Office. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-11: PAYMENT OF COSTS FOR REMOVAL OF VEHICLE:
Before any vehicle so removed and stored shall be reclaimed by the owner or other claimant, he shall satisfactorily identify himself and establish his right,
title or interest to said vehicle and shall pay all costs and charges in connection with the removal and storage of said vehicle and all costs of service of
notice. It shall be unlawful for any person to reclaim such vehicle without first paying all of the costs and charges pertaining to the removal and storage of
said vehicle. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-12: STARTING PARKED VEHICLE:
No person shall start a vehicle which is stopped, standing, or parked unless and until such movement can be made with reasonable safety. (Ord. 12-17,
12-18-2012)
9-10-13: COLLECTIONS OF FINES FOR ILLEGAL STOPPING, STANDING AND PARKING OF VEHICLES:
It shall be the duty of the Parking Enforcement Bureau to make regular collections of money for violations of this chapter with respect to the stopping,
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 203/358
standing and parking of vehicles and to transmit such funds to the City Clerk, as provided in section 8-2-5 of this Code, after which time the same shall be
deposited with the Director of Finance who shall credit the same as provided for in this Code. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-14: STOPPING, STANDING AND PARKING VIOLATIONS:
Any person who parks any vehicle in any public place in violation of the terms and provisions of this Code relating to the stopping, standing and parking of
vehicles, shall be guilty of a parking violation. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)

9-10-16: PARKING VIOLATION, NOTICE OF FINE:
A. Issuance; Copies: Where a parking violation is observed for which a fine is prescribed by section 9-10-15 of this chapter, a parking notice of fine may be
issued by any officer or parking enforcement employee of the Police Department, any officer or firefighter of the Fire Department or any other City
employee, or official, designated by the City Administrator. Notices of fine shall be issued electronically, or written upon serially numbered sets of
parking notice of fine forms with each copy to be clearly imprinted with the citation complaint number. Copies of the notice of fine forms shall be used
as follows: one (1) shall be used as a notice of fine and shall be delivered to the owner or operator of the vehicle, if present at the time the violation is
observed, or, in the alternative, securely affixed to the vehicle parked in violation of any provision of this Code for which a parking notice of fine is
authorized and one (1) shall be placed on file with the Parking Enforcement Bureau of the Mason City Police Department.
B. Violations: Whenever any motor vehicle without a driver is found parked or stopped in violation of any of the restrictions imposed by this chapter or any
other City ordinance, an officer or designated City employee finding such vehicle may take its registration number and such other information displayed
on the vehicle as may identify its owner or operator and shall conspicuously affix to such vehicle a notice of fine, in writing, on a form as provided
herein, for the owner or operator to appear on the charge against him or her at the Parking Enforcement Bureau of the Mason City Police Department
or at the City Clerk's Office as designated in the notice of fine.
C. Form Of Notice Of Fine: The parking notice of fine shall clearly identify: the serial number assigned to the notice; the date, time, and location of alleged
violation; the vehicle make and license plate; the employee's ID number; the alleged parking violation(s); the appropriate fine for the violation ticketed;
and similar instructions on how to respond or deny the parking notice of fine.
YOU MAY ADMIT THE VIOLATION BY PAYMENT OF A FINE OF $15.00 WITHIN 30 DAYS OR $20.00 THEREAFTER. THE FINE FOR PERSONS
WITH DISABILITY PARKING VIOLATIONS ARE $200.00 IF PAID WITHIN 30 DAYS AND $200 THEREAFTER. YOU MAY DENY THIS CHARGE BY
APPEARING AT THE PARKING ENFORCEMENT BUREAU AT THE MASON CITY POLICE DEPARTMENT OR AT THE OFFICE OF THE MASON
CITY CITY CLERK WITHIN 30 DAYS OF ISSUANCE.
Fines may be paid by depositing the correct amount in the envelope and either mailing it or delivery to the Mason City Police Department, 78 South
Georgia, or to the Mason City City Clerk's office, 10 1st St. N.W.
NOTICE: It may be illegal to park a vehicle upon the public streets, highways or parking lots within the City if there are four or more unpaid,
unanswered Notices pending against the owner of such vehicle. Vehicle owners with unpaid notices will be turned over to the County Treasurer for
collection. Vehicle owners with unpaid parking notices may be unable to register their vehicles until fines have been paid.
(Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-17: PARKING AREAS FOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES:
There are hereby established disabled parking areas upon the City streets, alleys and Municipal and private parking lots to be administered as follows:
A. A persons with disabilities parking permit shall be displayed in a motor vehicle as a removable windshield placard or on a motor vehicle as a plate or
sticker as provided in Iowa Code section 321L.2 when being used by a person with a disability, either as an operator or passenger. Each removable
windshield placard shall be of uniform design and fabricated of durable material, suitable for display from within the passenger compartment of a motor
vehicle and readily transferable from one vehicle to another. The placard shall only be displayed when the motor vehicle is parked in a persons with
disabilities parking space. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
B. The use of a persons with disabilities parking space, located on either public or private property as provided in Iowa Code sections 321L.5 and 321L.6,
by an operator of a motor vehicle not displaying a persons with disabilities parking permit; by an operator of a motor vehicle displaying a persons with
disabilities parking permit, but not being used by a person issued a permit or being transported in accordance with Iowa Code section 321L.2,
subsection 1b; or by a motor vehicle in violation of the rules adopted by the State Department of Transportation under Iowa Code section 321L.8,
constitutes improper use of a persons with disabilities parking permit, which is a misdemeanor for which a scheduled fine shall be imposed upon the
owner, operator, or lessee of the motor vehicle or the person to whom the persons with disabilities parking permit is issued. The scheduled fine for each
violation shall be as established in section 805.8A, subsection 1c of the Iowa Code. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012; amd. 2017 Code)
C. The Mason City Engineering Department shall designate, by appropriate signs, individual parking spaces upon streets, alleys and in Municipal and
private parking lots for vehicles operated by or for disabled persons. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-18: RESTRICTED PARKING IN FIRE LANES:
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 205/358
A. No person shall park a vehicle in any place designated by the Fire Department as a fire lane and posted as hereinafter provided, whether such fire lane
be upon publicly owned property or right-of-way or upon privately owned property.
B. A fire lane shall be posted at least every fifty (50) linear feet thereof with signs approximately twelve inches by eighteen inches (12" x 18") in dimension,
which at a minimum shall contain the following language:
FIRE LANE
NO PARKING
A fire lane shall be deemed to encompass that area within a twenty five foot (25') radius of any fire lane signposted pursuant to this section.
C. When an area is posted as a fire lane as provided in subsection B of this section, a presumption shall arise that said area was designated as a fire lane
by or with the authority of the Fire Department. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-19: ACTION REQUIRED UPON NOTICE OF FINE:
The owner or operator of a vehicle alleged to be parked in violation of this chapter shall admit or deny the violation within thirty (30) days of the date of the
notice of fine. A parking violation may be admitted by depositing the correct amount of the fine together with the notice of fine and mailing or by delivery of
the payment to the Office of the City Clerk or to the Parking Enforcement Bureau at the Mason City Police Department. A parking violation may be denied
by appearing in person at the Office of the City Clerk or at the Parking Enforcement Bureau at the Mason City Police Department. If a parking violation is
neither admitted by payment of the specified fine nor denied by appearance at the Office of the City Clerk or at the Parking Enforcement Bureau of the
Mason City Police Department within thirty (30) days of issuance, the violation may be charged by uniform citation in accordance with the laws of Iowa.
More than one (1) parking violation may be alleged in a single citation. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-20: DENIAL OF PARKING VIOLATION AND ASSIGNMENT OF COURT APPEARANCE DATE:
A person who appears at the Office of the City Clerk or at the Parking Enforcement Bureau of the Mason City Police Department may deny the parking
violation charged and may either request a court appearance date or may request an administrative review. If a court appearance date is requested, a
uniform citation shall be issued in accordance with Iowa law and a date provided upon which an appearance and plea to the charges contained in the
parking citation must be entered in the District Court of Cerro Gordo County, Iowa. The Parking Enforcement Bureau shall then cause the citation to be
filed with the Traffic Division of the Office of the Clerk of the District Court for Cerro Gordo County, Iowa. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-21: ADMINISTRATIVE REVIEW:
An owner or operator of a vehicle alleged to have been parked in violation of any regulation contained in this chapter may, at the time of appearance at the
Office of the City Clerk or at the Police Department on a notice of fine, request an administrative review of the alleged violation in lieu of a court
appearance. The request must be filed within thirty (30) days of the notice of fine. It shall be on a form approved by the Chief of Police and shall include
the name, mailing address and phone number of the person requesting the review and a statement of the facts upon which a denial of the charge is
based. The request for administrative review may be accepted by either the Office of the City Clerk or the Parking Enforcement Bureau at the Mason City
Police Department. The date of filing shall be noted on the request and shall stop the running of the thirty (30) day period during which the violation may be
admitted by payment of the initial fine amount. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-22: ADMINISTRATIVE REVIEW PANEL; PROCEDURE:
A. An administrative review panel comprised of a Police Department Supervisor, the City Clerk or the City Clerk's designee, and one (1) other City
employee designated by the City Administrator shall meet as needed to review written requests for administrative review. The panel shall rule on all
requests within thirty (30) days of the date the request was filed. The review shall be based on the written reasons stated in the request. A notice of fine
shall be voided by the panel if it finds the parking laws of the City or the State have been erroneously applied and may be voided upon a finding of
exigent circumstances which should excuse a violation of the parking laws of the City.
B. Persons requesting administrative review shall promptly be notified by ordinary mail of the action of the administrative review panel. If the panel
determines the notice of fine should be voided, such action shall be promptly taken by the Parking Enforcement Bureau. If the notice of fine is upheld,
the owner or operator shall be notified of a certain date before which the violation may be admitted by payment of the fine provided if paid before thirty
(30) days. The date shall allow a period of at least thirty (30) days from the date of the notice of fine, not including the period provided for administrative
review, and shall in no case be less than fourteen (14) days from the date of mailing of the notice. The said notice shall also inform the owner or
operator of his or her right to continue to deny the parking violation by requesting a date upon which to appear and enter a plea before the Traffic
Division of the Iowa District Court for Cerro Gordo County in the same manner as if the administrative review had not occurred. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-
2012)
9-10-23: FAILURE TO ADMIT OR DENY:
It is a violation of this section for the owner or operator of a vehicle to which a notice of fine has been issued to knowingly fail to admit or deny the parking
violation as provided in this chapter within thirty (30) days of the date of the violation. A knowing failure or refusal to admit or deny a parking violation
charged by notice of fine may be inferred whenever a written notice of failure to appear or admit one (1) or more notices of fine has been sent by ordinary
mail to the address of the registered owner of the vehicle as shown by the vehicle registration, and the owner or driver has not responded within ten (10)
days, and the notice has not been returned as being undeliverable.
Unpaid parking notices of fine will be forwarded to the Cerro Gordo County Treasurer's Office for collection. Failure to admit or deny a notice of fine may
prohibit the registered owner from renewing his or her vehicle registration until the notice of fine is resolved. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 206/358
9-10-24: HABITUAL VIOLATOR:
A. Habitual Violator Defined: Any person who has allowed four (4) or more parking violation notices of fine issued on a motor vehicle registered in that
person's name to become delinquent and to whom one (1) or more notices required by section 9-10-23 of this chapter has been sent shall be deemed
to be a habitual violator. For purposes of this section, a "delinquent parking notice of fine" is one which has not been paid within thirty (30) days of the
date of the violation and the owner or operator has not appeared within that time to deny the violation as required by this chapter.
B. Illegal To Park On Public Streets Or Lots: It is a violation of this section for any vehicle owned or operated by a habitual violator to be parked or allowed
to remain standing upon any public street, alley or public parking facility in the City.
C. Subject To Removal: A vehicle parked in violation of this section shall be in the status of an illegally parked vehicle and the vehicle may be towed or
removed from the public street or City owned parking lot, and may be temporarily prevented from being removed or moved through the use of a locked
wheel chocking device approved for use by the Chief of Police, as provided by section 9-10-9 of this chapter.
Before any vehicle removed and stored or disabled pursuant to this section may be reclaimed or returned to the registered owner or person having a
legal entitlement to the possession of the motor vehicle, such person shall personally appear in the Office of the Parking Enforcement Bureau of the
Mason City Police Department and pay in full all delinquent parking notices of fine pertaining to such vehicle. The Parking Enforcement Bureau shall,
upon payment of such delinquent parking citation/complaints, provide the registered owner or person having a legal entitlement to possession a written
release to be presented to the towing/impoundment entity which, upon payment of all towing and storing fees by the registered owner or person having
legal entitlement to possession, shall enable the individual to reclaim or redeem the impounded vehicle. If the vehicle has been disabled, the locking
device shall be removed upon payment of all delinquent notices of fine pertaining to such vehicle. (Ord. 12-17, 12-18-2012)
9-10-25: PRESUMPTION AND PENALTY:
For purposes of prosecution under this chapter, if a vehicle is found parked or left unattended in violation of the provisions of this chapter and the identity
of the operator cannot be determined at the scene of the violation, the registered owner thereof shall be prima facie responsible for said violation. (Ord. 12-
17, 12-18-2012)
ARTICLE A. ALTERNATE SIDE PARKING
9-10A-1: APPLICATION OF ARTICLE:
The provisions of this article prohibiting the standing or parking of vehicles or unattended vehicles on certain designated streets or parts of streets shall
apply from November 15 to March 31 of the following year unless suspended by the City Administrator. (Ord. 08-16, 11-4-2008)
9-10A-2: NOTIFICATION TO THE PUBLIC:
Alternate side parking shall be in effect from November 15 through March 31. The provisions of this article prohibiting parking on parts of streets and alleys
shall become effective on November 15 of each year through March 31 of the year following. The City shall notify the general public of the November 15
effective date each year through public announcement. (Ord. 08-16, 11-4-2008)
9-10A-3: PARKING PROHIBITED UNDER CERTAIN CONDITIONS:
It shall be unlawful for any person to park, abandon, or leave unattended any vehicle on any street or alley in violation of the following provisions:
A. Parking shall be prohibited on the odd numbered side of the street after seven o'clock (7:00) P.M. on an odd numbered day until four o'clock (4:00) P.M.
the following even numbered day.
B. Parking shall be prohibited on the even numbered side of the street after seven o'clock (7:00) P.M. on an even numbered day until four o'clock (4:00)
P.M. the following odd numbered day.
C. The changeover period shall be between the hours of four o'clock (4:00) P.M. and seven o'clock (7:00) P.M. of each day.
D. Parking shall be allowed on both sides of the streets on each Saturday from four o'clock (4:00) P.M. to ten o'clock (10:00) P.M. and also on each
Sunday from six o'clock (6:00) A.M. to one o'clock (1:00) P.M.
Exception: Parking shall be allowed on both sides of the street from four o'clock (4:00) P.M. to one o'clock (1:00) A.M. on Christmas Eve.
E. On cul-de-sacs bearing consecutive street numbers, parking is prohibited according to the schedule for the street side to which it connects.
F. During alternate side parking, signs prohibiting parking at all times on one (1) entire side of the street only shall not be enforced and alternate side
parking regulations shall be in effect.
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 207/358
G. Nothing contained in this section shall be construed to permit parking on streets where parking is prohibited on both sides at all times or during
specified hours nor permit parking in areas where parking is otherwise prohibited at all times except as permitted herein.
H. This article shall not apply to Highway 122 and U.S. Highway 65 south of Eighth Street south and north of Fifth Street north, nor to the business district.
(Ord. 08-16, 11-4-2008)
I. For purposes of this article, the term "business district" is defined as that area bounded by and including all streets which lie between Connecticut
Avenue on the east, Jefferson Avenue on the west, Fourth Street south on the south and Fifth Street north on the north.
Exception: During normal business hours, parking shall be permitted within one hundred feet (100') of the main entrance of a commercial business
location on the side adjacent to the business. (Ord. 09-02, 2-17-2009)
9-10A-4: SIGNS POSTED:
The provisions of this article shall be in full force and effect throughout the City when signs are posted on primary or secondary roads at or near their
points of intersection with the corporate boundaries of the City stating:
Alternate side parking is in effect November 15 through March 31.
(Ord. 08-16, 11-4-2008)
9-10A-5: REMOVAL OF PARKED OR UNATTENDED VEHICLES:
Any vehicle parked or otherwise left unattended in violation of any of the provisions of this article is declared to be a nuisance per se and shall be subject
to removal by the City by means of towing or otherwise. Any removal and resulting storage of such a vehicle shall be at the expense of the owner or
operator thereof as set out in section 9-10-11 of this chapter. (Ord. 08-16, 11-4-2008)
9-10A-6: SUSPENSION OF ALTERNATE SIDE PARKING:
Alternate side parking shall be in effect from November 15 through March 31 of each year. Alternate side parking may be suspended or terminated by the
City Administrator through a public announcement. (Ord. 08-16, 11-4-2008)
9-10A-7: PENALTY:
A. Any police officer of the Mason City Police Department, including any authorized volunteer officers, or the Operations Manager or the manager's
designee shall be authorized to cause the towing of vehicles blocking traffic or parking in violation of this Code. The owner of the vehicle shall pay the
costs of towing and storage occasioned by the removal of the vehicle as provided herein.
B. If a notice of fine for an alternate side parking violation, in a form and manner prescribed by section 9-10-16 of this chapter, has been given in the
manner prescribed in section 9-10-15 of this chapter, and the fine is not paid as prescribed in such notice and as established by this Code, the bureau
shall cause such violation to be filed against the registered owner thereof who shall be prima facie responsible for said violation. It shall be a
misdemeanor for any person to permit or allow a motor vehicle to be parked in violation of the provisions of this Code. The penalty for each violation
shall be fifteen dollars ($15.00). (Ord. 08-16, 11-4-2008)
9-10A-8: EXTENSION OF ALTERNATE SIDE PARKING:
The City Administrator, Operations Manager or designee may declare a snow emergency through public announcement between April 1 and November 14
of each year. Such public announcement of a snow emergency between April 1 and November 14 shall constitute notice to the general public and all the
provisions of this article shall be in effect until terminated by public announcement. (Ord. 08-16, 11-4-2008)
9-10A-9: EMERGENCY SNOW ROUTES:
The following streets are hereby designated as emergency snow routes:
First Street Northwest between Monroe Avenue to Pierce Avenue.
Alternate side parking rules in section 9-10A-3 of this article shall not apply to streets designated emergency snow routes. Emergency snow routes shall
be in effect when declared through public announcement by the City Administrator or designee until terminated by public announcement. Parking shall be
prohibited on both sides of the street designated as emergency snow routes when emergency snow routes are in effect. (Ord. 09-02, 2-17-2009)
ARTICLE B. RESIDENTIAL PARKING PERMIT DISTRICTS
9-10B-1: DEFINITIONS:
For use within this article, the following words and terms are defined:
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 208/358
ENTITLED MOTOR VEHICLE: Any motor operated vehicle licensed for use on the public roadway that is owned or operated by a resident within the
residential parking district listed on the permit or their guest.
PARKING TAG: A hanging tag that allows a person residing within a residential parking district to park an entitled motor vehicle in that district.
RESIDENT: A person residing within the residential parking districts.
RESIDENTIAL DISTRICT: A contiguous area containing a public street segment between at least two (2) intersecting streets, alleys or private drives
accessing three (3) or more lots abutted by residential property, or residential and nonbusiness property including, but not limited to, schools, parks,
churches, hospitals and nursing homes. (Ord. 13-30, 11-5-2013)
9-10B-2: ESTABLISHMENT OF RESIDENTIAL PARKING PERMIT DISTRICT DESIGNATION:
A. Action to establish a residential parking permit district designation may be made by a petition signed by one (1) adult occupant of each dwelling unit in
the residential district. The signatures must represent at least sixty percent (60%) of the dwelling units in the residential district.
B. Upon receipt of a valid petition, designation of notice shall be sent by regular mail to each residence in the proposed residential permit parking district
informing owner, tenant or party in possession of the date of Council consideration of the resolution. The City Council may adopt a resolution
designating the residential parking permit district.
C. The resolution establishing the residential parking permit district shall include the following:
1. The boundaries of the residential parking permit district; and
2. The days of the week and the hours during which a permit must be displayed; and
3. If the permit restrictions are not intended to be in effect year round, the dates when permit restrictions are effective; and
4. Any other restrictions deemed necessary by the City Council to ensure adequate parking for residents within the district.
D. The effective date of the residential parking permit designation shall be upon publication of the resolution.
E. Detailed records of each residential permit parking district shall be maintained in the City Clerk's Office. (Ord. 13-30, 11-5-2013)
9-10B-3: POSTING OF RESIDENTIAL PARKING PERMIT SIGNS:
Following adoption of a resolution designating a residential parking permit district, signs shall be erected in the designated area indicating the hours which
curbside parking in the residential parking permit district is prohibited, unless the entitled motor vehicle properly displays an authorized parking tag. (Ord.
13-30, 11-5-2013)
9-10B-4: NOTICE TO RESIDENTS OF DESIGNATION OF RESIDENTIAL PARKING PERMIT DISTRICT:
Following adoption of a resolution to designate a residential parking permit district, the City shall mail the following documents to the residents of every
dwelling within the designated district:
A. A notice of designation that shall inform the residents in the designated district of:
1. The existence, exact location and numerical designation, if any, of the residential parking permit district;
2. The parking restrictions applicable to all motor vehicle curbside parking spaces along streets in the designated area that do not properly display an
authorized parking tag;
3. The procedure to obtain residential parking tag(s).
B. A residential parking permit on which the applicant is to provide the following information for each vehicle to receive residential parking tag(s):
1. The name and residential address of the owner of the vehicle;
2. The signature of the applicant for the residential parking permit;
3. The number of parking tags requested. (Ord. 13-30, 11-5-2013)
9-10B-5: ISSUANCE OF RESIDENTIAL PARKING PERMIT:
A. Residential parking tag(s) shall be issued upon the submission of a completed residential parking permit. Not more than two (2) residential parking tags
shall be issued to each dwelling unit.
B. The residential parking tag shall hang from the interior rearview mirror with the tag number facing the windshield.
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 209/358
C. No residential parking tag(s) shall be issued for a vehicle whose owner is not a resident in the designated residential parking permit district.
D. The holder of the residential parking permit shall be the owner of the vehicle receiving the parking tag(s). (Ord. 13-30, 11-5-2013)
9-10B-6: RENEWAL OF RESIDENTIAL PARKING PERMIT:
A. The residential parking tag(s) shall be renewed annually during the month of July and will expire on July 31 of each year.
B. Upon the residential permit holder's submission of a completed residential parking permit, the holder shall receive new parking tag(s) valid for a one (1)
year period. (Ord. 13-30, 11-5-2013)
9-10B-7: EXCEPTIONS:
These provisions shall not apply to clearly marked service or delivery vehicles doing business in the designated residential parking permit district during
the time they are working in the district insofar as they are clearly marked. (Ord. 13-30, 11-5-2013)
9-10B-8: PROHIBITED ACTS:
It shall be a violation for any person to:
A. Park an entitled motor vehicle in designated residential parking districts during restricted hours without displaying the proper tag by hanging the tag from
the interior rearview mirror with the tag number facing the windshield.
B. Represent in any manner or form that a motor vehicle is entitled to an authorized parking permit when it is not so entitled. The display of a parking tag
on a motor vehicle not entitled to such a parking tag shall constitute such a representation and shall be a simple misdemeanor.
C. Duplicate, or attempt to duplicate, by any means, a parking tag. It shall also be a violation to display upon any vehicle such a duplicate parking tag.
These shall be simple misdemeanors. (Ord. 13-30, 11-5-2013)
9-10B-9: PENALTY:
If a notice of fine for prohibited acts in a residential parking permit district violation, on a form and manner prescribed by section 9-10-16 of this chapter,
has been given in the manner prescribed in section 9-10-15 of this chapter, and the fine is not admitted or denied as prescribed in such notice and as
established by this Code, the bureau shall cause such violation to be filed against the registered owner thereof who shall be prima facie responsible for
said violation. It shall be a misdemeanor for any person to permit or allow a motor vehicle to be parked in violation of the provisions of this Code. The
penalty for each violation shall be fifteen dollars ($15.00) if paid within thirty (30) days of issuance. After thirty (30) days, the fine increases to twenty
dollars ($20.00).
A violation of prohibited acts in subsections 9-10B-8B and C of this article constitutes a simple misdemeanor. (Ord. 13-30, 11-5-2013)
9-10B-10: WITHDRAWAL OF DESIGNATION OF RESIDENTIAL PARKING PERMIT DISTRICT:
A. Action to withdraw a residential parking permit district designation may be made by a petition signed by one (1) adult occupant of each dwelling unit in
the residential parking permit district. The signatures must represent at least sixty percent (60%) of the dwelling units in the designated district.
B. Upon receipt of a valid petition, the City Council shall set a public hearing on the question of withdrawing the residential parking permit district
designation. A notice shall be sent by regular mail to each residence in the residential permit parking district informing owner, tenant or party in
possession of the date of Council consideration of the resolution potentially withdrawing the residential parking permit district.
Upon completion of the public hearing, the City Council may repeal the resolution designating the residential parking permit district.
C. Following any repeal of the resolution establishing a residential parking permit district, a notice shall be sent by regular mail to each residence in the
residential permit parking district informing owner, tenant or party in possession of the withdrawal of residential parking permit district status.
D. The effective date of withdrawal of the designation shall be upon publication of the repealing resolution. (Ord. 13-30, 11-5-2013)
