Title 10
BUILDING REGULATIONS
Chapter 1
NUMBERING OF BUILDINGS
10-1-1: NUMBERING OF BUILDINGS:
All buildings, houses, portions of land and lots adjacent to or abutting upon streets and avenues shall be known and designated by the numbers on the
plat and schedule of building numbers in the City on file in the Office of the City Engineer, and entitled and designated HOUSE NUMBERS. (1953 Code
§ 5-1; amd. Ord. 91-3, 2-5-1991; 2017 Code)
10-1-2: DUTY TO NUMBER:
As provided in section 364.12(3d), Code of Iowa, it shall be the duty of the owner of any building facing, abutting or opening upon any street or avenue or
other public way in the City to place upon said building suitable numbers composed of figures not less than three inches (3") in height and of, or painted
on, glass or some metallic substance, and shall conform to and be in accordance with the plat and schedule of building numbers referred to in section 10-
1-1 of this chapter. (1953 Code § 5-2; amd. 1985 Code)
At the time of building permit approval, the City Engineer or designee shall assign an address to a new or relocated structure. Each structure shall be
assigned only one (1) address, unless otherwise approved by the City Engineer. (2017 Code)
10-1-3: NEW CONSTRUCTION:
Any building facing, abutting or opening upon any street, avenue or public way hereafter moved, erected, constructed or completed shall, upon the
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 212/358
completion of the construction or moving thereof, be promptly numbered by the owner thereof in accordance with the plat and schedule of building
numbers referred to in section 10-1-1 of this chapter. (1953 Code § 5-3)
10-1-4: MAINTENANCE OF NUMBERS:
It shall be the duty of the owner of any premises required herein to be numbered to maintain such building numbers in good condition and in a
conspicuous place where the same may be seen and read from the street. (1953 Code § 5-4)
10-1-5: CITY TO PLACE NUMBERS:
Should any owner fail to number or to maintain numbers upon any building owned by him, as required by the provisions of this chapter, for a period of ten
(10) days after the same is required, the City Engineer may cause such numbers to be placed and shall report the cost thereof to the City Council who
shall assess the same against the property or premises so numbered and order the same collected with the ordinary taxes assessed against such
premises. (1953 Code § 5-5)
Chapter 2
BUILDING CODES
ARTICLE A. BUILDING CODE
10-2A-1: CODE ADOPTED:
There is hereby adopted as the Building Code of the City, the most current edition of the International Building Code adopted by the State of Iowa Building
Code Commissioner's Office, reviewed and/or modified, from time to time, by the Building Advisory and Appeals Board and the Chief Building Official,
which Building Code, which by this reference, is duly adopted, with the following amendments, as fully and completely as if set out in detail herein.
An official copy of the International Building Code, as hereby adopted, including a certificate by the City Clerk as to its adoption and the effective date
thereof, is now on file in the Office of the City Clerk and at the City Public Library for public inspection. (Ord. 17-5, 6-6-2017)
10-2A-2: AMENDMENTS TO BUILDING CODE:
The City Building Code shall be amended as follows:
Section 101.1 Title. (Name of jurisdiction) City of Mason City, Iowa.
Section 101.4.1 Gas. Change "international" to "uniform".
Section 101.4.3 Plumbing. Change "international" to "uniform", delete last sentence.
Section 101.4.4 Property Maintenance. Delete entire paragraph.
Section 102.6 Existing Structures. Delete "International Property Maintenance Code".
Section 103.3 Deputies. Delete last sentence.
Section 105.2(1) Work Exempt From Permit. Building.
Section 105.2(1), referring to "one story detached accessory building, used as tool and storage sheds", shall be and the same is hereby repealed.
Section 109.2, chapter 1 of the International Building Code pertaining to permit fees, shall be as follows: Building permit fees shall be set by resolution of
the City Council.
Section 423.3 Critical Emergency Operations. Delete.
Section 423.4 Group E Occupancies. Delete.
Chapter 11 Accessibility. Delete.
Chapter 27 Electrical. Delete.
Chapter 28 Mechanical Systems. Delete.
Chapter 29 Plumbing Systems. Delete.
Appendix A-K. Delete in "International Building Code" 2009.
(Ord. 17-5, 6-6-2017)
10-2A-3: BUILDING INSPECTIONS DIVISION:
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 213/358
There is hereby established in the administrative body of the City, within the Development Services Department, the Building Inspections Division. Said
division shall be the "enforcement agency" for all matters contained in this title. The division shall be under the supervision of the Chief Building Official.
A. Duties: It shall be the duty of the Chief Building Official for the City to administer and enforce all of the Building Codes adopted by ordinance by the City
Council to provide a safe and sanitary environment for the citizens of Mason City. Said Chief Building Official shall be empowered to inspect any and all
buildings and other structures, public or private and to, as herein provided, condemn and order removed or remodeled and put into proper and safe
condition for the citizens of this City, as set out in the building codes of the City. (Ord. 13-07, 3-5-2013)
10-2A-4: BUILDING ADVISORY AND APPEALS BOARD:
A. Board Established: There is hereby created a Building Advisory and Appeals Board, as required by chapter 1, section 112 of the International Building
Code and this Code, which shall be composed of five (5) members, appointed by the Mayor with the approval of the City Council. The Chief Building
Official shall be an ex officio member and shall act as Secretary to the board.
B. Appointment; Terms: Said members of the board shall be appointed by the Mayor subject to the approval of the City Council, and shall serve for a
period of five (5) years from April 1 following their appointment, except appointments to fill vacancies for the unexpired term of any member. Any
member may be removed from office by the Mayor for cause.
C. Organization Of Board: The board shall elect a Chairman and Vice Chairman from among its members. Such Chairman, or in his absence the Vice
Chairman, may administer oaths and compel the attendance of witnesses. The board shall meet at City Hall, and all meetings of the board shall be
open to the public. The presence of three (3) members shall constitute a quorum. The board shall keep minutes of its proceedings, showing the vote of
each member upon each question, or if absent or failing to vote, indicating such fact, and it shall keep records of its examinations and other official
actions, all of which shall be immediately filed in the Office of the Chief Building Official and the City Clerk and shall be a public record.
D. Duties And Powers: The Building Advisory and Appeals Board shall have the following powers and duties:
1. Adopt reasonable rules and regulations, and shall render all decisions and findings in writing to the Chief Building Official with duplicate copies to the
appellant and the City Clerk.
2. Recommend to the City Council such new legislation as is consistent therewith.
3. Hear and decide appeals where it is alleged there is error in any order, requirement, decision or interpretation made by the Chief Building Official in
the enforcement of the Building Code as set out in this article.
4. Authorize upon appeal modifications to the Building Code, as provided in section 104.10 of the International Building Code, the compliance of any
order or interpretation of the Chief Building Official as will not be contrary to the public interest, where owing to special conditions a literal
enforcement of the provisions of this Code will result in unnecessary hardship and so that the spirit of the Code shall be observed and substantial
justice done.
E. Factors To Be Considered: In considering all appeals to the Building Code, the board shall, before making any finding in a specific case, first determine
that the proposed modification will not impair the public health, safety, comfort, morals and welfare of the City.
In the event that a modification is granted, the board shall observe the conditions as set out in sections 104.11, 104.11.1 and 104.11.2 of the
International Building Code.
1. In lieu of or in addition to administrative regulations, the board may grant a limited extension of time for the compliance of any order or notice,
provided the board makes specific findings of fact based on evidence relating to the following:
a. There are practical difficulties in carrying out the strict letter of any notice or order; and
b. Such an extension is in harmony with the general purpose and intent of this chapter in securing the public health, safety and general welfare.
2. The board may grant a modification in a specific case and from a specific provision of this title subject to appropriate conditions; and provided the
board makes specific findings of fact based on the evidence presented in the record as a whole and related to the following:
a. There are practical difficulties in carrying out a strict interpretation or order; and
b. Due to the particular circumstances presented, the effect of the application of the provisions would be arbitrary in the specific case; and
c. Such modification is in harmony with the general purpose and intent of this title in securing the public health, safety and general welfare.
F. Adoption Of Modification: Upon appeal, or by adoption of a modification, the board, by a majority vote, may approve a modification for the building of a
new structure which cannot practicably meet the standards of the Code. Prior to considering any modification, public notice shall be given. A
modification, if granted, shall:
1. State in what manner the modification from the specific provision(s) is to be allowed; and
2. State the conditions under which the modification is to be made; and
3. Be based upon specific findings of fact based on evidence related to the following:
a. There are practical difficulties in carrying out the strict letter of the specific provision common to structures to which the modification will apply; and
b. Such modification is in harmony with the general purpose and intent of this title in securing the public health, safety and general welfare.
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 214/358
G. Appeals Board Jurisdiction: Any persons affected by any written notice, but not limited to the following notices, or any persons wishing to submit any
petition, but not limited to the following petitions, may appeal to the Building Advisory and Appeals Board in accordance with the City administrative
procedures ordinance:
1. Notice of Building Code violation.
2. Petition for modification. (Ord. 04-4, 1-6-2004)
10-2A-5: APPEALS, METHOD OF FILING:
The Building Advisory and Appeals Board shall hear and decide appeals from and review any order, requirement, decision or interpretation made by the
Chief Building Official in the enforcement of the Building Code. Appeals to the board may be filed by any person aggrieved, or by any officer, department,
board or bureau of the City affected by any decision of the Chief Building Official. Such appeal shall be filed within ten (10) days from the date of the
offending ruling, decision, interpretation or order of the Chief Building Official with the Building Advisory and Appeals Board, a notice of appeal specifying
the grounds thereof. A filing fee of thirty dollars ($30.00) shall be paid to the City Clerk by the party filing such an appeal. (Ord. 04-4, 1-6-2004; amd. 2017
Code)
A. Appeals Board Procedures: Any builder, engineer, architect or developer entitled to service under the Building Code may appeal from any requirement,
decision, interpretation, order or any action of the Chief Building Official under this title by filing such appeal at the Office of the Chief Building Official,
Mason City, Iowa. All appeals shall be in writing and submitted to the Chief Building Official containing the following information:
1. Names of all appellants participating in the appeal.
2. A brief statement setting forth the legal interest of each of the appellants involved in the notice and order.
3. A brief statement in ordinary and concise language of that specific order or action protested, together with any material facts claimed to support the
contentions of the appellant.
4. A brief statement in ordinary and concise language of the relief sought and the reason(s) why it is claimed the protested order or action should be
reversed, modified or otherwise set aside.
5. The signatures of all parties named as appellants and their official mailing addresses.
6. The verification (by declaration under penalty of perjury) of at least one (1) appellant as to the truth of the matter stated in the appeal.
B. Scheduling And Notice Of Hearing: As soon as practicable after receiving the written appeal, the Chief Building Official shall fix a date, time and place
for the hearing of the appeal by the board. Such date shall be not less than ten (10) days nor more than sixty (60) days from the date the appeal was
filed with the Chief Building Official. Written notice of the time and place of the hearing shall be given at least ten (10) days prior to the date of the
hearing to each appellant by the Secretary of the board either by causing a copy of such notice to be delivered to the appellant personally or by mailing
a copy thereof, postage prepaid, addressed to the appellant at his address shown on the appeal. Said notice of hearing shall be by certified mail.
C. Hearing: The procedures will be conducted as set out in the City administrative procedures ordinance. The concurring vote of three (3) members of the
board, or in the case of only having a quorum for said hearing the concurring vote of two (2) members, shall be necessary to reverse any order,
requirement, decision or determination of the Chief Building Official or to decide in favor of the applicant on any matter upon which it is required to pass
under the Building Code or to effect any modification in this Code.
Any person or persons, jointly or severally, aggrieved by a decision of the Building Advisory and Appeals Board shall have recourse to trial as provided
by statute.
D. Decision On Appeal: In exercising the powers granted, the Building Advisory and Appeals Board may, in conformity with law, modify the order,
requirement, decision or interpretation appealed from and may make such order, requirement, decision or interpretation as should be made, and to that
end, shall have all the powers of the officer from whom the appeal is taken. (Ord. 04-4, 1-6-2004)
10-2A-6: MOVING OF STRUCTURES:
A. Definitions: For the purpose of this section, the following words shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them in this subsection:
ALTERNATE MATERIALS AND METHODS OF CONSTRUCTION: Interpreted as set out in section 104.11 of the International Building Code.
MODIFICATION: Interpreted as set out in section 104.10 of the International Building Code.
STREET: All public streets, roads, highways, alleys or other public places.
STRUCTURE: Any house, garage, building or other object which is to be moved on structure movers' trucks or skids.
TESTS: Interpreted as set out in section 104.11.2 of the International Building Code.
B. License Required, Fee And Term: No person shall move or cause to be moved upon, over or across any street or from any lot or parcel of ground to
another lot or parcel of ground any structure unless such person has qualified as a structure mover and has obtained a license to engage in such
business from the City Clerk as hereinafter provided. As application for the license, the structure mover shall include information related to his/her
experience in moving structures and the equipment to be used. The license fee to be paid for said license shall be in the amount of fifty dollars ($50.00)
and shall expire on March 31 of each year.
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 215/358
1. Exception: A structure with a ground floor area of seven hundred fifty (750) square feet or less, has no horizontal dimension greater than twenty five
feet (25') and a loaded height no greater than fifteen feet (15') may be moved by an unlicensed person; provided, that all other requirements of this
chapter are met.
C. Moving Permit Required: Every person shall, before moving any structure, obtain a moving permit from the Chief Building Official. The fee for a moving
permit shall be calculated in the same manner as a building permit.
D. Insurance Required: Except for a move exempted under subsection B1 of this section, prior to issuance of a moving permit, the applicant shall file proof
of public liability insurance for the period said permit is in effect with minimum limits of five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000.00) for property
damage, one million dollars ($1,000,000.00) for a single personal injury or death, and three million dollars ($3,000,000.00) for multiple injuries or
deaths, which insurance shall indemnify and hold harmless the City on account of any and all damage or injury, including death, to real or personal
property, whether public or private, which arises out of or is connected with or caused by the moving of any structure over, upon or across any public
street, alley or other public place.
E. Application For Permit: An application for a moving permit shall be in writing upon forms furnished by the Chief Building Official and shall contain,
among other things, the following information:
1. The name and address of the applicant, proof of licensing (if not exempt) and equipment proposed to be used.
2. The dimensions of the structure to be moved and its maximum heights when loaded.
3. The present location and the proposed location of the structure.
4. The route over which the structure is to be moved, the type and height above the street of obstructions, including trees, the time when removal will
begin and the approximate length of time necessary to complete the operation.
5. The time when the structure will be first moved into or within the corporate limits and the length of time said structure will be in the process of moving
within said limits.
6. The name and address of the owner of said structure and the proposed use of said structure upon its new location if such new location is within the
City.
F. Additional Notice: The Development Review Committee may require the owner or mover to provide additional public notice, through publication of a
notice in the official newspaper and/or other means, if the proposed move involves a long period, may disrupt activities on adjacent properties along the
move route or at the site to which the structure is moved, or will potentially block or slow progress on arterial or collector streets during peak hours.
G. Development Review Committee: All permit applications to move a structure within the City limits shall be reviewed by the Development Review
Committee, as established in section 12-7-1 of this Code. The Development Review Committee shall review the proposed time of the move, the move
route of the structure, determine if City and public utilities are affected, review the final placement of the structure and advise the Chief Building Official
regarding any pertinent requirements affecting or affected by the proposed move. Any utility or similar entity with equipment or appurtenances located
within, over or upon any street located within the path of the move shall be notified of the date, time and place of the meeting. The Development
Review Committee may require additional review for certain structures and moving routes prior to final consideration of a permit by the Chief Building
Official.
H. Other Agencies: If a structure is moved upon, over or across any street or crossing under the jurisdiction of any other agency or entity (such as the Iowa
Department of Transportation or a railroad), the appropriate permits or waivers, if required, shall be applied for prior to approval of a moving permit by
the City. Proof of application for or issuance of such permit(s) or waiver(s) shall be provided to the Chief Building Official. If the affected agency or entity
cedes jurisdiction to the City, written confirmation of the same from the affected agency shall be provided. The structure shall not be moved until all
required permits or waivers have been issued.
I. Final Placement Of Structure: The structure shall meet all applicable requirements of the zoning district applying to the lot upon which the structure is to
be moved, according to title 12 of this Code, as well as all applicable requirements of this title.
J. Issuance Of Permit: Upon a determination by the Chief Building Official that all requirements are met, the Chief Building Official shall issue the permit.
K. Denial Of Permit: The Chief Building Official shall deny a permit to move a structure when the City Engineer determines that the structure is of such
size, weight, dimensions or character as to likely cause substantial damage or injury to any street or to any private property abutting a street, including
trees overhanging a street or alley, unless necessary accommodations can be made with the City and/or adjoining private property owners to mitigate
any negative impacts.
L. Clearing Of Route:
1. The City of Mason City Arborist Department, upon request, may assist the mover in the proper pruning and clearing of City owned trees or trees
otherwise encroaching upon the right-of-way. Should this department be unavailable to perform said trimming, the mover may employ a licensed and
bonded tree trimmer from a list of such businesses approved by the City.
2. The mover shall make all arrangements and accommodations for raising or otherwise moving of utility lines or structures with the appropriate utility
company.
M. Escort: The Chief Building Official, in consultation with the City Engineer, may require that part or the entire move be escorted by warning vehicles,
consisting of vehicles displaying flashing lights and "Wide Load" signs as necessary. Alternatively, the Chief Building Official may require the move to
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 216/358
be escorted by police vehicles. The structure mover shall schedule the move according to available police personnel, as determined by the Chief of
Police, and shall pay all associated costs.
N. Planking Street: The City Engineer shall have the authority to require the planking of any street when such planking is deemed advisable by him, having
due regard for the place, manner, form, condition and type of street over which the structure is to be moved.
O. Restrictions During Move:
1. Caution Signals: It shall be the duty of the structure mover to provide proper caution lights or flares during the hours of darkness and to provide
flagmen when necessary for the safe movement of the structure on any public street.
2. Barricading Intersections: It shall be the duty of the structure mover to place barricades in the intersections of streets when required by the City
Engineer or when reasonably required for public safety.
3. Parking Restrictions: If required by the City Engineer, the structure mover shall place "No Parking By Order Of Police" signs in visible locations in the
right-of-way, at least twenty four (24) hours prior to the move.
4. Barricades And Signs: All barricades and signs shall conform to the current edition of the "Manual On Uniform Traffic Control Devices" (MUTCD).
The applicant shall provide conforming barricades and/or signs, or may obtain them from the Operations and Maintenance Department during
regular business hours, upon payment of a deposit to ensure return of the barricades and/or signs in good condition.
P. Bridge Restrictions And Weight Limit Embargoes:
1. Any move route that requires passage over bridges or overpasses shall be reviewed by the City Engineer. If the City Engineer determines that a
structural analysis is warranted, related costs or a portion thereof may be assessed to the applicant.
2. Any move route over streets with weight limit embargoes shall be reviewed by the City Engineer. The City Engineer may deny use of any embargoed
street.
Q. Report To City Engineer And Chief Building Official: Every person granted a permit for the moving of a structure shall report to the City Engineer and
the Chief Building Official within twenty four (24) hours after the moved structure is placed upon any lot within the City. It shall be the duty of the City
Engineer, within ten (10) days after receipt of such report, to inspect all streets over which said structure has been moved and to determine the extent
of the damage to such streets or private property abutting such streets. If the moving of said structure has caused any damage to such streets or
private property, the said mover shall be responsible for repairs or replacement, meeting current State, County and/or City requirements and standards.
Upon failure of the mover to complete repairs or replacement in a reasonable time after notice from the City Engineer of the damage or injury required
to be repaired, said City Engineer may repair or cause to be repaired said damage and injury and hold sureties on the mover's bond or on the
insurance carrier responsible for payment and the cost of such repairs.
In addition to the above damages, costs will be filed for damages to trees and shrubbery at the current cost of the species and labor.
R. Report To Police, Fire Department, Utility Companies During Move: Every mover shall report to the Chief of the Fire Department or his assistants, the
Chief of the Police Department or his assistants, and affected utility companies each night the exact location of the structure while being moved. Except
under unavoidable circumstances, no structure shall be left standing on any street for a period of more than twenty four (24) hours.
S. Unlawful Moving: It shall be unlawful for any person to move or cause to be moved a structure upon, over or across any street, except the route
designated, within the time specified and with the equipment specified by the permit granted for the moving of such structure. An extension of time may
be granted by the Chief Building Official under unavoidable circumstances.
T. Temporary Placement Of Moved Structure: A structure that has been moved from its original site shall not be temporarily placed on any parcel for a
period of longer than forty eight (48) hours. The Chief Building Official may grant an extension if a structure is in the act of being moved in accordance
with a valid moving permit, and unavoidable circumstances require a structure to be temporarily placed on a parcel other than the parcel indicated on
the moving permit. This requirement shall not apply to structures placed temporarily on City owned property, if approved by the City Administrator.
U. Building Advisory And Appeals Board Authority: In addition to the authority granted to the Building Advisory and Appeals Board by this article, the
Building Advisory and Appeals Board shall have authority to require the Chief Building Official to issue or deny issuance of a permit for the moving of
any structure where, by reason of peculiar topographical conditions or other unusual circumstances or conditions, the strict enforcement of the
limitations of this title would be unreasonable and would amount to a practical confiscation of the structure, and would result in particular hardship upon
the owner, other than the costs related to the move; provided, that the relief sought can be granted without substantial detriment to the public good and
without injury to streets and property abutting thereon and without substantially impairing the general intent and purpose of this title. (Ord. 13-09, 3-19-
2013)
ARTICLE B. ELECTRICAL CODE
10-2B-1: GENERAL PROVISIONS:
A. This Electrical Code establishes the office of electrical inspector; prescribes the duties of said inspector; provides the rules for the prevention of fire,
safety of life and the installation of wiring and equipment and operation thereof; provides for permits and permit fees for the installation of electrical
equipment and wiring; provides for the examination and licensing of electricians; provides for the adoption of the current edition of the National
Electrical Code as set out in section 10-2B-15 of this article; and provides a penalty for the violation hereof. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010; amd. 2017 Code)
10-2B-2: ELECTRICAL INSPECTOR:
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 217/358
A. Office Established: There is hereby established in the Building Inspections Services Division of the City, an electrical inspection office, consisting of one
(1) electrical inspector, under the supervision of the Chief Building Official. The term "inspector" as used within this article shall mean "electrical
inspector". The electrical inspector shall enforce the provisions of this Code and all building codes in a manner consistent with the intent thereof. The
inspector shall perform the duties necessary for the enforcement of the Electrical Code of the City and to act as a designated representative of the
Chief Building Official as needed.
B. Qualifications:
1. The electrical inspector shall either be licensed as a master electrician or possess equivalent knowledge and experience to that of a master
electrician and receive a master electrician's license within one (1) year of employment by the City of Mason City. A new hire for the position of
electrical inspector who fails to obtain a master electrician's license within one (1) year from the date of employment, or an incumbent electrical
inspector who fails to maintain a master electrician's license, shall be immediately terminated by the Chief Building Official. The new hire shall also
obtain, within two (2) years, a certification as an electrical inspector that is acceptable to the Chief Building Official.
2. The inspector may hold membership in the International Association Of Electrical Inspectors and the National Fire Protection Association and, with
the approval of the Chief Building Official, may serve on any electrical committee to which the inspector may be appointed. Membership dues and
itemized necessary expenses in connection with such activities may be paid by the City.
3. The inspector shall not engage in the business of sale, installation or maintenance of electrical equipment, either directly or indirectly, and shall have
no financial interest in any concern engaged in such business in the City at any time while holding office. This shall not be construed in any way to
prevent the inspector from performing such services for the City as may be required.
C. Duties: The inspector shall inspect all work authorized by any permit to assure compliance with provisions of this Code and peripherally all codes or
amendments thereto, approving or condemning said work in whole or in part as conditions require. The inspector may issue, upon request, a certificate
of approval for any work approved. The inspector shall condemn and reject all work done or being done or materials used or being used which do not,
in all respects, comply with the provisions of these codes and amendments thereto; and shall order changes in workmanship or materials or both,
essential to obtain compliance with the provisions of these codes. The electrical inspector shall investigate any construction or work regulated by these
codes and shall issue such notices and orders as provided in the following subsections:
1. Right Of Entry:
a. Whenever it is necessary to make an inspection to enforce any of the provisions of or perform any duty imposed by this Code or other applicable
law, the inspector, or a duly authorized representative, hereby is authorized to enter such property at any reasonable time and to inspect the same
and perform any duty imposed upon the inspector by this Code or other applicable law; provided, that:
(1) If property is occupied, the inspector shall first present proper credentials to the occupant and request entry explaining the reasons therefor;
(2) If property is not occupied, the inspector shall first make a reasonable effort to locate the owner or other persons having charge or control of the
property and request entry, explaining the reasons therefor. If entry cannot be obtained because the owner or other person having charge or
control of the property cannot be found, after due diligence or if entry is refused, the inspector, or authorized representative, shall have recourse
to every remedy provided by law, to secure lawful entry and inspect the property.
b. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if the inspector, or authorized representative, has reasonable cause to believe the building or premises is so
hazardous, unsafe or dangerous as to require immediate inspection to safeguard the public health or safety, the inspector shall have the right to
immediately enter and inspect such property, and may use any reasonable means required to effect such entry and make such inspection, whether
such property be occupied or unoccupied and whether or not permission to inspect has been obtained. If the property be occupied, the inspector
shall first present proper credentials to the occupant and demand entry, explaining the reasons therefor and the purpose of the inspection.
No person shall fail or refuse, after proper demand has been made as provided in this subsection, to promptly permit the inspector, or authorized
representative, to make any inspection provided for by this subsection C. Any person violating this subsection shall be guilty of a misdemeanor.
2. Reinspections:
a. The inspector is hereby authorized and empowered to make at such times and as often as, in the inspector's discretion, it may seem necessary,
thorough reinspection of the installation in or on any building, structure or premises of all electrical wiring, electrical devices and electrical material
now installed or that may hereafter be installed.
b. When the installation of any such wiring device or material is found to be in violation of this Code, the person, firm, corporation or governmental
agency owning, using or operating the same, shall be notified in writing and shall make the necessary repairs or changes required to place such
wiring, device or material in compliance with this Code and to have such work completed within a period of ten (10) days after such notice, or
within such other reasonable period specified by the electrical inspector in said notice and shall pay such fees as are required by this Code.
c. When an additional inspection trip is necessary to correct a violation of the Electrical Code, an additional fee (set by a resolution of the City
Council) for each trip may be charged at the discretion of the Chief Building Official.
3. Authority To Disconnect:
a. The inspector is hereby empowered to disconnect or to order, in writing, the discontinuance of electrical service to wiring, devices or materials
found to be dangerous and a hazard to life, health and property until the installation of such wiring device or material has been made safe as
directed by the inspector.
b. Any person, firm, corporation, public utility, political subdivision or governmental agency ordered to discontinue such electrical service shall do so
within twenty four (24) hours after the receipt of such written notice and shall not reconnect such service or allow or cause the same to be
reconnected until notified to do so by the electrical inspector. Refusal or failure or neglect to comply with any such notice or order shall be
considered, by the inspector, a violation of this Code. The inspector may then institute any appropriate action or proceeding to prevent, restrain,
correct or abate the refusal to comply with any such notice or order. The Chief Building Official, the Chief of the Fire Department, or the duty
officer, shall also have the authority to cause the discontinuance of electrical energy to a structure or component when hazardous to firefighters in
their line of duty or work.
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 218/358
4. Stop Orders: Whenever any work regulated by this Code is being done contrary to the provisions thereof, the electrical inspector may order the work
stopped by notice, in writing, served on any persons engaged in doing or causing such work to be done and any such persons shall forthwith stop
such work until authorized by the electrical inspector to proceed with the work. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-3: LICENSES:
No person, firm or corporation shall engage in or cause the installation, maintenance, alteration or repair of any electrical equipment within the scope of
this Code unless such person, firm or corporation shall first have obtained from the City of Mason City or the State of Iowa an electrical contractor's license
or a City electrical maintenance license. Nor shall any electrical contractor employ any but licensed master electricians, electrical journeymen, qualified
electrical apprentices or unclassified workers licensed by the State of Iowa working under the supervision, direction and control of a licensed master
electrician or a licensed journeyman electrician, and also with the exception that no license shall be required in order to execute or perform any of the
classes of electrical work exempted by the provisions of this article. Every person holding a valid State of Iowa license shall register with the City electrical
inspector of the City of Mason City prior to performing any electrical work within the corporate limits of the City of Mason City. Each registrant shall place
on file with the City electrical inspector a copy of his/her State of Iowa license.
No license shall be required for any of the following described work:
A. Electrical Supply Agencies: The installation, alteration or repair of electrical equipment installed by or for any electrical supply agency in the generation,
transmission, distribution or metering of electricity.
B. Electrical Equipment Or Apparatus: Any work involved in the manufacturing, testing, repairing, servicing of electrical equipment or apparatus, except
that this exemption shall not include any permanent wiring.
C. Elevators And Escalators: Any work involved in the erection, installation, repairing, remodeling or maintenance of elevators (freight or passenger),
dumbwaiters or escalators, not including electrical energy to the control panels of elevators, dumbwaiters or escalators.
D. No License Required For Homeowners: A permit shall be issued to a homeowner who proposes to install, repair or add to the electrical system in said
homeowner's existing, single-family dwelling, which is used as the homeowner's permanent place of residence; provided, that each of the following
conditions shall be fulfilled:
1. Such owner has applied, to the electrical inspector, for the homeowner's permit.
2. The fee, for each homeowner's permit, has been paid to the City through the Building Inspections Services Division.
3. Said homeowner shall have submitted a detailed plan of all work to be performed. This plan shall be reviewed by the electrical inspector to verify that
said homeowner understands the requirements that will be required for all electrical work pertaining to the permit to be issued.
4. The homeowner shall personally perform all labor in connection with the work done under the provisions of this section, shall meet the materials and
workmanship requirements of the Mason City Electrical Code and shall be inspected the same as any work done by a licensed electrical contractor.
E. Replacement Of Lamps: No license shall be required for the replacement of lamps.
F. Routine Maintenance: Routine maintenance allowed under section 10-2G-3 of this chapter. (Ord. 10-19, 11-16-2010)
10-2B-4: CLASSES OF LICENSES:
The following classes of licenses shall be issued by the City which shall be designated as:
Class I Electrical contractor's license
Class II Electrical maintenance license
Class III Electrical journeyman's license
Class IV Electrical master's license
A. Class I, electrical contractor's license: This license shall entitle the holder thereof to engage in the business of and to secure permits for the installation,
alteration, repair of any electrical devices, appliances or equipment, but shall not authorize the holder thereof to do the work of installation, alteration or
repair without also being a holder of an electrical master's license.
Applications must be filed in duplicate on forms provided by the electrical inspector, for a contractor's license and must include the business address of
his establishment.
A contractor's license may be issued to a person, firm or corporation. If issued to a firm or corporation, an electrical supervisor, who is a licensed
master electrician, must be employed. In addition to a license, any person, firm or corporation engaged as a contractor in doing electrical wiring or
installing any electric wires, apparatus or appliances and holding a Class I license, as provided in this Code, must file with the City Clerk general and
complete operations liability insurance in the amount of at least one million dollars ($1,000,000.00) for all work performed which requires licensing
pursuant to this Code. The carrier of any insurance coverage maintained by this licensee to meet this requirement shall notify the City Clerk thirty (30)
days prior to the effective date of cancellations or reduction of the coverage.
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 219/358
B. Class II, electrical maintenance license: This license shall entitle the holder thereof to undertake the work of and secure an annual license for
maintaining and repairing electrical devices, appliances and equipment; provided, that the holder of such license regularly employs, as supervisor, one
(1) or more persons certified by the Board of Electrical Examiners and Appeals as being qualified for such work; and provided, that such work shall be
confined to the premises owned or occupied by the holder of said license, the location of which premises shall be described in the license.
Maintenance workers, performing electrical work, shall place on file with the City Clerk a copy of his/her electrical license. The electrical inspector shall
be informed of changes in personnel.
C. Class III, electrical journeyman's license: This license shall entitle the holder thereof to perform any work of installing, maintaining, altering or repairing
electrical equipment as an electrical journeyman under the direction of the holder of an electrical contractor's license by whom he is employed. In order
to obtain a journeyman electrician's license, the applicant for a journeyman's license shall have completed an Apprenticeship Training Program
registered by the Bureau of Apprenticeship and Training of the United States Department of Labor in accordance with the standards established by that
department or shall have received training or experience for a period of time and under conditions as established by the Board of Electrical Examiners
and Appeals. In addition, an applicant shall meet examination criteria based upon the most recent National Electrical Code as adopted by the Board of
Electrical Examiners and Appeals. All experience requirements and qualifications must be met to allow one to take examination.
Every holder of a license shall keep his or their license in his or their place of business at all times.
D. Class IV, master electrician license: Except as otherwise provided by law, no person shall plan, install, repair, lay out or supervise the installation of
wiring, apparatus, or equipment for electrical light, heat, power or other purposes unless the person is: 1) licensed by the board as a master electrician;
and 2) the work is for a licensed electrical contractor and the person is an employee, partner or officer or is the licensed electrical contractor.
An applicant for a master electrician license shall have had at least one (1) year's experience acceptable to the Board of Electrical Examiners and
Appeals as a licensed journeyman and successfully passed the master electrician's examination approved by the Board of Electrical Examiners and
Appeals. All experience requirements and qualifications must be met to allow one to take the examination. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-5: LICENSE FEES:
Fees for the respective licenses shall be set by a resolution of the City Council. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-6: EXPIRATION OF LICENSE:
A. If the license is allowed to expire for more than one (1) year, an applicant will be required to take the examination and upon passing said examination
and payment of the required fees will be issued a license. Exception: Licensees that have successfully passed a certified proctored examination
approved by the Board of Electrical Examiners and Appeals.
B. No examination will be required if contractor's license is not allowed to expire.
C. All locally licensed electricians must complete six (6) hours of approved continuing education courses before they can renew their local license. Within a
three (3) year period, the contact hours shall include a minimum of six (6) hours of studying the most current National Electrical Code as adopted by
the City of Mason City. A copy of the certificate of training must be submitted to the Mason City electrical inspector before renewal of license. (Ord. 10-
06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-7: FRAUDULENT USE OF LICENSES:
It shall be a violation for any person, firm or corporation to misrepresent fact or attempt to use any license of another person, firm or corporation. (Ord. 10-
06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-8: BOARD OF ELECTRICAL EXAMINERS AND APPEALS:
A. Creation: There is hereby created a Board of Electrical Examiners and Appeals which shall consist of five (5) members to be appointed by the Mayor
subject to the approval of the City Council. The members shall be residents or be employed within the City of Mason City and at least shall be licensed
electrical contractors and at least two (2) licensed electrical journeyman. Every member shall be appointed for three (3) years, said term beginning on
July 1. The Mayor may remove any member for just cause. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010; amd. 2017 Code)
B. Organization Of Board: The members of the Board of Electrical Examiners and Appeals shall annually elect a Chairman. The electrical inspector shall
be Secretary to the board and shall preserve and keep a record of all proceedings before the board, including the records and documents pertaining to
examinations and other proceedings. The members of the board shall be provided a suitable room for its meetings and necessary incidental expenses,
said board to act without compensation.
C. Duties Of Board: It shall be the duty of the Board of Electrical Examiners and Appeals to meet at the call of the Chairman or Secretary or upon call of a
majority of its membership. The board shall, within ten (10) days, report in writing to the Mayor, City Clerk and the applicant, the result of all
examinations, together with their recommendations, as to the issuance or denial of all licenses as the case may be. Licenses shall be issued when
approved by a majority of the board by the City Clerk.
D. Suspension Or Revocation: The board shall have the power to suspend or revoke any local license or renewal thereof, for any fraud or
misrepresentation in obtaining the licensing, for failure to comply with any of the provisions of this chapter, the Electrical Code or other ordinances, as
for negligence, incompetence or misconduct in the performance of any duties of an electrical contractor or electrician, as outlined in the following
procedure:
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 220/358
In all cases involving revocation or suspension of a license, at least fifteen (15) days' notice shall be served upon the holder whose license is in
question and said notice shall indicate the date, time and place of hearing and the general grounds for the contemplated revocation or suspension. The
notice shall also advise the holder of his or her right to appear at said hearing in person, or by counsel, for the purpose of being heard.
E. Right To Appeal Decision Of Board Of Electrical Examiners And Appeals: Any applicant shall have the right to appeal to the City Council any ruling of
the board by filing a written notice of such appeal with the City Clerk within ten (10) days from the date of ruling therefrom appealed. The Council shall
forthwith fix a date, time and place of hearing on such appeal which shall not be less than five (5) days nor more than fifteen (15) days after the date of
said filing of the notice of appeal and the City Clerk shall notify the interested person, by certified mail, of the time and place of said hearing. After
hearing said appeal, the City Council may sustain or overrule the ruling of the board. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-9: RIGHT TO APPEAL DECISION OF ELECTRICAL INSPECTOR:
A. Any person, firm or corporation aggrieved by any ruling, decision, interpretation or order of the electrical inspector or his duly authorized representative
shall have the right to appeal to the Board of Electrical Examiners and Appeals by filing a written notice of such appeal within ten (10) days from the
date of the offending ruling, decision, interpretation or order.
B. Upon fixing of such notice, a date, time and place for the hearing shall be fixed, which time shall be no more than fifteen (15) days after the date of filing
the notice of appeal, and the person appealing shall be notified of the date, time and place of such hearing. Hearings on the appeal shall be open to
the public and all interested persons shall be given an opportunity to present their position. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-10: AUTHORITY OF BOARD OF ELECTRICAL EXAMINERS AND APPEALS:
A. The Board of Electrical Examiners and Appeals shall have the authority by majority to vote to affirm, modify or reverse any ruling, decision,
interpretation or order of the electrical inspector and to permit modification from the strict terms and provisions of this Code when such modification can
be made without increasing the hazards to the health or safety of person or property and when such modification shall not violate the intent and
purposes of this Code. Mere inconvenience to the appellant shall not be grounds for the granting of such modification.
B. The Board of Electrical Examiners and Appeals will periodically review the Electrical Code and shall furnish written recommendations to the City Council
for updating said Code. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-11: PERMITS FOR ELECTRICAL WORK:
A. Required Prior To Commencement: All electrical work, as set forth in this section, shall not commence until a permit is issued by the electrical inspector.
Except as provided by law, where work has been started prior to obtaining a permit, the regular fee therefor shall be doubled. The inspection and
enforcement provisions shall apply to the following:
1. All new electrical installations for commercial or industrial applications, including installations both inside and outside of buildings, and for public use
buildings and facilities and any installation at the request of the owner.
2. All new electrical installations for residential applications in excess of single-family residential applications.
3. All new electrical installations for single-family residential applications requiring new electrical service equipment or requiring a building permit.
4. Existing electrical installations observed during inspection which constitutes an electrical hazard. Existing installations shall not be deemed to
constitute an electrical hazard if the wiring when originally installed was installed in accordance with the Electrical Code in force at the time of
installation and has been maintained in that condition.
5. The inspector shall require submission of plans and specifications, drawings, descriptions and diagrams as necessary to show clearly the character,
kind and extent of electrical work covered by applications for a permit and, upon approval thereof, shall issue the permit applied for.
6. The electrical inspector shall collect such fees as are required by this Code and issue receipts therefor, copies of which shall be maintained as a
record in said inspector's office. The inspector shall transfer all fees collected to the proper authority provided by law to receive such funds.
7. Minor repairs: A permit is not required for the replacement of lamps, connection of electrical equipment by attachment cord and cap to permanently
installed receptacles, or the replacement of faulty equipment.
B. To Whom Issued: A permit shall be issued only to an electrical contractor licensed by the City or State of Iowa. Furthermore, any permit required by this
Code may be issued to the owner of a single-family dwelling or mobile home used exclusively for living purposes, to do any work regulated by this
Code as set forth in subsection 10-2B-3D of this article.
C. To Obtain Permit: Prior to commencement of any electrical installation, the person making such installation shall apply for and obtain a permit for said
work except in the case of an emergency. The application shall include the name and business address of the person, firm, corporation or other
association that is to do the work. A description of the property, name of the occupant of said property and a general description of the materials to be
used shall be included and shall specify the particular part or parts of work which requires inspection in conformity with the provisions of this Code.
The application shall be accompanied by fees in accordance with the schedule of fees set out in subsection E of this section.
D. Permit Regulations:
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 221/358
1. Fraudulent Application For Permit Illegal: It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to present any fraudulent information in making
application for any permit from the electrical inspector. Furthermore, it shall be unlawful to use the name of another person, firm or corporation in
order to secure an electrical permit unless regularly employed by and directly authorized by the holder of such electrical contractor's license.
2. Revocation Of Permit: Any permit issued that contains fraudulent information or violates the rules of any ordinance issued by the City of Mason City
or any Code issued by the State of Iowa shall be subject to revocation at the direction of the electrical inspector. The person holding the permit shall
be notified to appear and show cause why the permit should not be revoked and failure to appear shall be deemed sufficient to cause the permit to
be revoked.
E. Permit Fees:
1. Fees Set By Resolution: Permit fees shall be set by a resolution of the City Council.
2. Payment Of Fees: All fees herein shall be paid to the electrical inspector payable to the City. Any deficiency in previous fees shall be paid before
another permit is issued. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-12: ELECTRICAL SERVICE CONNECTIONS:
It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation generating electrical energy for electric light, heat or power in the City to set a meter for electrical
usage in any building or premises containing electrical wiring or equipment which has not been inspected and approved by the electrical inspector or his
duly authorized representative. Any person, firm or corporation violating the provisions of this section shall, upon written notice from the inspector to do so,
immediately remove such conditions and discontinue such electrical usage. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-13: COVERING WORK BEFORE INSPECTION:
No person having charge of construction, alteration or repair of any building or any other person shall cover or conceal or cause to be covered or
concealed any wires or electrical apparatus for which a permit is required before the said wiring or electrical apparatus has been inspected and approved.
(Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-14: POWER OF INSPECTOR IF WORK IS COVERED:
The electrical inspector shall have the authority to remove or cause the removal of lath, plasterboard or other covering which may prevent the proper
inspection of electrical wiring or electrical apparatus. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-15: NATIONAL ELECTRICAL CODE:
A. Except as added to, deleted, modified or amended in this article, there is hereby adopted as a portion of this Electrical Code the current edition of the
National Electrical Code (NFPA 70) as sponsored by the National Fire Protection Association under the auspices of the American National Standards
Institute.
B. The electrical inspector shall require that hereinafter the installation of all electric light and power wiring, all electrical fixtures and appliances and all
electrical work shall be of such grade and type as to conform with the standard practices of the National Electrical Code except as modified or
amended in this Code. All existing electrical apparatus, wiring, fixtures and appliances shall be made to conform to the requirements of this Code when
so ordered by the electrical inspector. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-16: AMENDMENTS TO NATIONAL ELECTRICAL CODE:
The National Electrical Code is subject to the following exceptions, modifications and additions:
A. Grounding: The grounding of wiring installation for services shall be made with an approved clamp on the street side of the water meter at a point near
the entrance to a building. Minimum conductor to be used is size no. 6 copper. This conductor shall be installed in such a way as not to be subject to
severe mechanical injury by following different structural components and securely fastened in all its travels or it may be laid in the concrete floor, but
the inspector must be assured that it is a continuous piece of copper and that no connections are made that depend on solder.
B. New Service: When a new service is installed to an existing structure all unfinished areas shall be upgraded to meet all requirements included in this
Code and all requirements of the current NEC. Existing wiring in finished areas shall meet the Code requirement at the time period of its installation.
C. Wiring In Dwellings: For installation of electrical wiring in dwellings, including multiple-family dwellings, any of the wiring methods of chapter 3 of the
National Electrical Code may be utilized, except above unstructured ceilings and unfinished basements (exposed floor joists), a metallic raceway
system shall be used. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
Exception: Up to four feet (4') of cable may be exposed if protected from physical damage. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010; amd. 2017 Code)
D. Outside Wiring:
1. Overhead conductors between buildings and structures shall be bracketed on the exterior of each building. When services terminate on the roof of a
building, adequate structural strength must be added to roof structure to compensate for strain of service conductors on the structure and shall be
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 222/358
securely bracketed and waterproofed at all points of roof rupture.
2. Whenever an existing service is repaired, altered, damaged by fire or in deteriorating condition or damaged by other means, it shall be made to
comply in all respects with the provisions of this Code to the discretion of the AHJ.
E. Commercial Wiring:
1. All wiring in excess of ninety (90) V to ground shall be installed in an approved raceway system.
2. When a new service is installed, existing wiring shall meet the Code requirements for the time period of its installation. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010)
10-2B-17: PENALTY FOR VIOLATIONS:
See general penalty section 1-4-1 of this Code. (Ord. 10-06, 5-4-2010; amd. 2017 Code)
ARTICLE C. PLUMBING CODE
10-2C-1: CODE ADOPTED:
Except as hereinafter added to, deleted, modified or amended, there is hereby adopted as the Mason City Plumbing Code, the most current edition, of the
Uniform Plumbing Code, as published by the International Association Of Plumbing And Mechanical Officials, as adopted by the State of Iowa, which
Plumbing Code is, by this reference, duly adopted. Said Plumbing Code of the City and its provisions shall be controlling in the construction and
maintenance of plumbing and in all other matters covered by said Plumbing Code within the corporate limits of the City. (Ord. 13-11, 4-2-2013; amd. 2017
Code)
10-2C-2: AMENDMENTS:
The following sections of the Code are hereby amended, deleted, modified or added to as more specifically set forth in the following subsections:
A. Owner's Permit: In cases where the owner of a property desires personally to do plumbing work upon premises which are then his or her legal domicile
or residence or for which the owner has a valid homestead exemption, said owner may appear before the plumbing/mechanical inspector and, upon
establishing that said person is competent to do the specific work for which the permit is desired and upon paying the permit fees as hereinafter set
forth, the plumbing/mechanical inspector shall issue a permit to such applicant and no other or different license or permit shall be required of such
person, any other terms or provisions of the Plumbing Code to the contrary notwithstanding. (Ord. 13-11, 4-2-2013)
B. Fee Schedule: Plumbing permit fees shall be set by resolution of the City Council. (Ord. 16-9, 5-17-2016, eff. 7-1-2016)
10-2C-3: CODE ON FILE:
An official copy of the Mason City Plumbing Code as hereby adopted, including a certificate by the City Administrator/City Clerk as to its adoption and
effective date thereof, is now on file in the Office of the City Administrator/City Clerk and the Public Library for public inspection.
Copies of the Uniform Plumbing Code can be obtained from IAPMO Headquarters, 5001 Philadelphia St., Ontario, CA 91761-2816. Copies of the Iowa
State Plumbing Code can be obtained from Department of Health, Lucas Office Building, 321 E. 12th St., Des Moines, IA 50319-0075. (Ord. 13-11, 4-2-
2013)
10-2C-4: PLUMBING/MECHANICAL INSPECTOR:
A. Office Established: There is hereby established in the Building Inspections Division of the Development Services Department a plumbing/mechanical
inspection office, consisting of one (1) plumbing/mechanical inspector under the supervision of the Chief Building Official.
B. Enforcement: The plumbing/mechanical inspector shall enforce the provisions of this Code and all building codes in a manner consistent with intent
thereof. The plumbing/mechanical inspector shall perform the duties necessary for the enforcement of the Plumbing and Mechanical Codes of the City
and to act as the designated representative of the Chief Building Official.
1. The duties of the plumbing/mechanical inspector may be assumed by the Chief Building Official.
C. Qualifications: The plumbing/mechanical inspector shall have the qualifications of a master plumber, with at least five (5) years' practical experience as
a master plumber, shall hold an Iowa master plumber's license and an Iowa master HVAC license, shall hold a certification as a plumbing/mechanical
inspector that is acceptable to the Chief Building Official, and shall receive such salary and compensation as may be fixed and determined by the City
Council.
D. Duties: It shall be the duty of the plumbing/mechanical inspector to see that the construction, reconstruction and maintenance of plumbing, roof and
house drainage systems in buildings and the ventilation and water supply thereto constructed in such buildings and within five feet (5') outside the
foundation thereof, shall conform to and be in compliance with the terms and provisions of the Plumbing, Mechanical and Fuel Gas Piping Codes.
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 223/358
The plumbing/mechanical inspector shall approve or reject all plans submitted. He shall keep a daily record of his work, including notices served,
applications received, permits granted and known or suspected violations of the Plumbing, Mechanical and Fuel Gas Piping Codes, and all other
matters pertaining to the terms and provisions of said codes.
The plumbing/mechanical inspector shall keep a record of all work hereafter done in new or old structures or buildings and see that all such work is
done in compliance with said codes and pursuant to a permit obtained therefor. He shall have power to stop any work being done contrary to the terms
and provisions of said codes and to revoke any permit granted for the same. He shall have the police power to enter any buildings or structures or
other property during reasonable hours for the purpose of executing the duties assigned to him by said Plumbing, Mechanical or Fuel Gas Piping
Codes.
The plumbing/mechanical inspector shall see that all plumbing, mechanical and gas piping work receives such tests as are prescribed in said
Plumbing, Mechanical and Fuel Gas Piping Codes, and shall approve or reject all such work, and shall issue a certificate accepting or rejecting such
work by posting the same in some conspicuous place in the building, structure or other property in connection with which the work is being done. He
shall have the power to condemn any plumbing, mechanical or fuel gas piping work whenever the same is not reasonably safe and sanitary or may
recommend the condemnation of such work to the Chief Building Official.
In newly annexed areas, or in existing areas receiving initial sanitary sewer main service, the plumbing system in existing buildings may be accepted by
the plumbing/mechanical inspector as suitable for connection to the City sanitary sewer system; provided, that all new portions of the plumbing system
comply with the provisions of this Code; and further provided, that any unsafe or hazardous plumbing is corrected. (Ord. 13-11, 4-2-2013)
10-2C-5: LICENSE REQUIRED:
No person shall construct, reconstruct, alter or repair any plumbing, roof or house drainage system or the ventilation thereof or repair, install or connect in
any way to the sewer or water supply of the City or do any other plumbing or gas piping work in or to any building without first having obtained the
necessary license as required by the State of Iowa. A plumbing contractor license shall entitle the holder to engage in the business of and secure permits
for the installation, alterations, and repair of plumbing appliances and equipment. (Ord. 13-11, 4-2-2013)
10-2C-6: BOARD OF PLUMBING APPEALS:
A. Board Established: In order to hear and decide appeals of orders, decisions or determinations made by the plumbing/mechanical inspector relative to
the application and interpretations of this Code, there shall be and is hereby created a Board of Plumbing Appeals which shall consist of seven (7)
residents of the City. One (1) member shall be a member of the public, one (1) member shall be a building contractor, two (2) members shall be the
holders of master plumber's licenses, two (2) members shall be the holders of journeyman plumber's licenses and one (1) member shall be the holder
of a master HVAC license. The plumbing/mechanical inspector shall be an ex officio member and shall act as Secretary to said board, but shall have
no vote upon any matter before the board. The Board of Plumbing Appeals shall meet as needed. The Board of Plumbing Appeals shall have no
authority relative to interpretation of the administrative provision of this Code nor shall the board be empowered to waive requirements of this Code.
B. Appointment: Members of the Board of Plumbing Appeals shall be appointed by the Mayor subject to the approval of the City Council, and shall serve a
five (5) year term.
C. Meetings: Said board shall adopt reasonable rules and regulations for the conduct of its business and the hearing of appeals and shall make its
decisions or findings in writing. The meetings of said Board of Plumbing Appeals shall be held in the City Hall in such reasonable quarters as may be
therein provided by the Council, and shall meet at the call of the Chairman of said board, but not more often than once each calendar month.
D. Right To Appeal: Any person aggrieved by any ruling, decision, interpretation or order of the plumbing/mechanical inspector shall have the right to
appeal to the Board of Plumbing Appeals by filing a written notice of such appeal with the City Clerk within ten (10) days from and after the date of the
ruling, decision, interpretation or order from which appeal is taken.
E. Notice Of Hearing: Upon the filing of such notice of appeal, a time and place for hearing by the Board of Plumbing Appeals shall be fixed, which time
shall be not more than fifteen (15) days after the date of filing such notice of appeal, and the person appealing shall be notified of the time and place of
such hearing. Hearings on appeal shall be open to the public and all interested persons shall be given an opportunity to present their position.
F. Authority Of Board Of Plumbing Appeals: The Board of Plumbing Appeals shall have authority to determine the suitability of alternate materials or type
of construction and to provide for reasonable interpretation of the provisions of the Plumbing Code, and to permit variance from the strict terms and
provisions of the Plumbing Code when such variance can be made without increasing hazards to public health or safety, and when the granting of such
variance would not violate the intent and purposes of the Plumbing Code. Mere inconvenience to the aggrieved party shall not be grounds for granting
of any variance or for the modification or reversal of any ruling, decision, interpretation or order of the plumbing/mechanical inspector.
G. Periodic Review Of Mason City Plumbing Code: In addition to the functions and duties of the Board of Plumbing Appeals as stated in this section, said
board shall periodically review and evaluate the provisions of the Mason City Plumbing Code and shall furnish written recommendations to the City
Council for updating said Code.
H. Right To Appeal Decision Of Board Of Plumbing Appeals: Any applicant shall have the right to appeal to the City Council any ruling of the Board of
Plumbing Appeals, by filing a written notice of such appeal with the City Clerk within ten (10) days from the date of ruling therefrom appealed. The
Chief Building Official shall forthwith fix a time and place of hearing on such appeal which shall not be less than five (5) days nor more than fifteen (15)
days after the date of filing of the notice of appeal, and the City Clerk shall notify the interested person, by certified mail, of the time and place of said
hearing. After hearing said appeal, the City Council may sustain or overrule the ruling of the Board of Plumbing Appeals. (Ord. 13-11, 4-2-2013)

ARTICLE F. HOUSING CODE
10-2F-1: PURPOSE AND SCOPE:
A. Title: This article shall be known and cited as the MASON CITY HOUSING CODE hereafter referred to as "this Code" or the "Housing Code". This Code
incorporates the requirements of both the Iowa Code and the housing quality standards established by the United States Department of Housing and
Urban Development.
B. Purpose: The purpose of the Mason City Housing and Property Maintenance Code is to ensure that housing facilities and conditions protect and
promote the health, safety and welfare of people who reside in Mason City and the general public as well.
C. Scope: This article shall apply to all dwellings within the jurisdiction of the City of Mason City used or intended to be used for human occupancy, except
for "temporary housing" as defined herein. (Ord. 04-3, 1-6-2004; amd. 2017 Code)
12/7/2019 Sterling Codifiers, Inc.
https://www.sterlingcodifiers.com/codebook/index.php?book_id=382 225/358
10-2F-2: CODE ADOPTED:
Except as hereinafter added to, deleted, modified or amended, there is hereby adopted as the Housing Code of the City, the 2015 edition of the
International Property Maintenance Code, or the most current edition, as prepared and edited by the International Code Council, regulating and governing
the conditions and maintenance of all property, buildings and structures; by providing the standards for supplied utilities and facilities and other physical
things and conditions essential to ensure that structures are safe, sanitary and fit for occupations and use; and the condemnation of buildings and
structures unfit for human occupancy and use, and the demolition of such existing structures in the City; providing for the issuance of permits and
collection fees therefor. (2017 Code)
This section has been affected by a recently passed ordinance, 19-10 - HOUSING CODE. Go to new ordinance.
10-2F-3: AMENDMENTS TO CODE; CHAPTER 1:
Chapter 1, Scope And Administration, of the 2015 International Property Maintenance Code (or the most current edition) is adopted, except as hereby
amended, deleted, modified, revised, or added to, as specifically set forth as follows:
A. 101.1, Title: Delete and replace. These regulations shall be known as the International Property Maintenance Code of the City of Mason City, Iowa,
hereinafter referred to as "the Housing Code", or "this Code".
B. 103.1, General: Delete and replace. Enforcement and administration of this Code shall be the responsibility of the Code official, under direction of the
Director of Development Services.
C. 103.5, Fees: Delete and replace. The fees for activities and services performed by the Development Services Department in carrying out its
responsibilities under this Code shall be determined from time to time by resolution adopted by the City Council.
D. 106.3, Prosecution Of Violation: Delete and replace last sentence only. Any action taken by the authority having jurisdiction on such premises shall be
charged against the real estate upon which the structure is located and shall be a lien upon such real estate and may be collected by any other legal
means or resource.
E. 109.1, Imminent Danger: Delete and replace first and second sentences only. When, in the opinion of the Code official, there is imminent danger of
failure or collapse of a building or structure which endangers life, or when any structure or part of a structure has fallen and life is endangered by the
occupation of the structure, or when there is actual or potential danger to the building occupants or those in the proximity of any structure because of
explosives, explosive fumes or vapors or the presence of toxic fumes, gases or materials, or operation of defective or dangerous equipment, or when
the occupants are using the premises for illegal activities or storage of illegal substances that may pose a danger to the occupants or persons in
proximity thereof, the Code official is hereby authorized and empowered to order and require the occupants to vacate the premises forthwith. The Code
official shall cause to be posted at the front or main entrance to such structure a placard declaring the structure to be unsafe and prohibiting its
occupancy.
F. 111.1, Application For Appeal: Delete and replace first sentence only. Any person directly affected by a decision of the Code official or a notice or order
issued under this Code shall have the right to appeal to the Housing Advisory and Appeals Board, provided that a written application for appeal is filed
no more than twenty (20) calendar days after the action or decision being appealed.
G. 111.2, Membership Of The Board: Delete and replace. The board shall be comprised of five (5) persons who shall be appointed by the Mayor with
approval of the City Council. The Code official shall serve as a non-voting ex-officio member of the board.
H. 111.2.1, Alternate Members: Delete.
I. 111.2.2, Chairman: Delete and replace. Chair and Vice-Chair. The board shall elect a Chair and Vice-Chair from among its members. Such Chair, or in
his/her absence, the Vice-Chair, shall conduct all meetings and may administer oaths and compel the attendance of witnesses.
J. 111.2.4, Secretary: Delete and replace. The Code official shall serve as Secretary to the board and shall distribute all decisions and findings in writing to
the landlord and the occupant. The Secretary shall cause all records and minutes of the board to be maintained by the Development Services
Department and the City Clerk.
K. 111.2.6, add subsection: Terms: Members of the board shall be appointed for terms of five (5) years, from the first day of April following their
appointment, except for appointments to fill vacancies which shall be for the unexpired term of any member. The Mayor, for cause, may remove any
member from office. Upon completion of their term of office, members shall continue to serve in their full capacity until a successor has been duly
appointed.
L. 111.2.7, add subsection: Vacancies: Vacancies on the board caused by death, resignation or other reason shall be promptly filled by appointment of the
Mayor and approval of the City Council for the unexpired term of office.
M. 111.3, Notice Of Meetings: Delete and replace. Upon receipt of a complete appeal application and filing fee, the Code official shall establish a date for
the hearing to be held within fifteen (15) business days of the date upon which the completed application was received, and shall send a notice of the
hearing to the appellant as well as the respective property owner and occupant, if different from owner.
